results.name: Trona
results.description_short: Chemically similar to wegscheiderite; compare thermonatrite and 'UM1974-04-CO:HNa'.

results.name: Tsaregorodtsevite
results.description_short: Sodalite Group. The mineral contains (as the only one known) the tetramethylammonium ion, [N(CH3)4]+.

results.name: Tschermakite
results.description_short:
Tschermakite is defined as a Tschermakite Group member with Mg>Fe2+ and Al>Fe3+ in the C position. Tschermakite has been redefined in the 2012 Amphibole nomenclature in that:
1) The formula is changed from ☐(Ca2)(Mg3AlFe3+)(Al2Si6O22)(OH)2 to ☐(Ca2)(M...

results.name: Tschermigite
results.description_short:
Note: Specimens frequently offered for sale of 'tschermigite' as large, good quality purple crystals on matrix are artificially created specimens made by growing crystals of this ammonium alum in a laboratory.

Godovikovite is a dehydration product o...

results.name: Tschernichite
results.description_short:
Zeolite Group. Faujasite Subgroup.

A possible Mg analogue of a tetragonal polymorph of tschernichite is known as UM2002-40-SiO:AlCaHKMgNa.

results.name: Tsnigriite
results.description_short: Compare, e.g., 'Unnamed (Silver Antimony Telluride Sulfide)'.

results.name: Tsumcorite
results.description_short:
Tsumcorite Group.

See also Cobalttsumcorite and Nickeltsumcorite.

results.name: Tsumebite
results.description_short:
The phosphate analogue of arsentsumebite.

A secondary mineral in polymetallic ore deposits. Chemically verified Tsumeb tsumebite is rare and most unanalyzed specimens so labeled are, most likely, arsentsumebite.

results.name: Tsumoite
results.description_short: Possibly in a polymorphic relation with UM1990-77-Te:BiPb.

results.name: Tučekite
results.description_short: Hauchecornite Group.

results.name: Tugtupite
results.description_short:
See also: Sodalite Group.

Piezoelectric.

results.name: Tuhualite
results.description_short: Tuhualite Group.

results.name: Tulameenite
results.description_short: Possibly forms a solid solution with Tetraferroplatinum.

results.name: Tundrite-(Ce)
results.description_short: Closely related to kihlmanite-(Ce).

results.name: Tundrite-(Nd)
results.description_short: Note that the mineral was accepted automatically, without detailed investigation and description of type material. Only a single Nd-dominant analysis was published. In other words, tundrite-(Nd) is a very doubtful mineral, which nobody saw and nobody h...

results.name: Tungstenite
results.description_short: Molybdenite Group.

results.name: Tungstibite
results.description_short: The Sb analogue of Russellite.

results.name: Tungstite
results.description_short: May originate as a dehydration product of hydrotungstite. A hydrated counterpart of liguowuite.

results.name: Tungusite
results.description_short: Gyrolite Group.

results.name: Tuperssuatsiaite
results.description_short:
Palygorskite Group.

At least two visually similar, isomorphous species are known (Cámara et al., 2002). See also windhoekite.

results.name: Turneaureite
results.description_short: A member of the Apatite Group of the Apatite Supergroup. The arsenate analogue of Chlorapatite. The Ca5 analogue of Hedyphane. The Cl analogue of Johnbaumite and Svabite.

results.name: Turquoise
results.description_short:
Turquoise Group. Chalcosiderite-Turquoise Series. Planerite-Turquoise Series. The copper analogue of Faustite.

A secondary mineral occurring in the potassic alteration zone of hydrothermal porphyry copper deposits. Also formed by the action of meteo...

results.name: Tuscanite
results.description_short: A 2D-zeolite that - alongside with the related latiumite - may be considered a prototype of advanced ion-exchange & ion/proton conductivity materials.

results.name: Tuzlaite
results.description_short: Note: Some acicular gypsum from Niedersachswerfen has been erroneously sold as tuzlaite.

results.name: Tvedalite
results.description_short: May belong to the Zeolite Group (uncertain since crystal structure has not been determined yet).

results.name: Twinnite
results.description_short:
Sartorite Group.

Related to guettardite (Sb:As = 1:1) and hyršlite (Sb:As = 6:10).

results.name: Tychite
results.description_short:
Northupite Group. Ferrotychite-Tychite Series. 
magnesium analogue of Ferrotychite and Manganotychite.

A complete series between Tychite and Northupite exists in artificial material.

results.name: Tyretskite
results.description_short: Hilgardite Group.

results.name: Tyrolite
results.description_short:
A secondary mineral found in the oxidized zones of copper deposits.

Material from the type locality is monoclinic (P2/c; polytype tyrolite-1M); a C-centred monoclinic polytype also exists at the type locality and is called tyrolite-2M (Krivovichev e...

results.name: Tyrrellite
results.description_short:
Se analogue of carrollite and Co analogue of nickeltyrrellite. Unique combination of elements.
Compare bornhardtite.

Occurs as small grains that look like clausthalite without the cleavage.

results.name: Tyuyamunite
results.description_short:
Carnotite Group.

A secondary mineral occurring in the oxidized zones of U-V deposits, especially those of the Colorado Plateau-type.

Visually indistinguishable from metatyuyamunite and other uranyl vanadates. Tyuyamunite easily dehydrates in dry ...

results.name: Tangeite
results.description_short:
Adelite-Descloizite Group. Conichalcite-Tangeite Series.

This name replaced calciovolborthite (Basso et al., 1994).

A secondary mineral found in sandstone and in the oxidized zones of vanadium-bearing deposits.
Easily confused with the copper va...

results.name: Uchucchacuaite
results.description_short:
The Mn analogue of baiamareite.

An Mn-substituted member of the Andorite series.

Chemically similar to menchettiite, oyonite, and uchucchacuaite. Also compare ramdohrite and 'dürfeldtite'; and luboržákite.

results.name: Uklonskovite
results.description_short: Maybe a product of supergene alteration of kononovite.

results.name: Ulexite
results.description_short:
A rare sodium-calcium borate.

Most specimens of ulexite are fibrous in nature. Most of the times the fibers are intergrown into felt like aggregates.  Most familiar to collectors is the kind of ulexite that is popularly called TV rock because of its...

results.name: Ullmannite
results.description_short: Cobaltite Group. Ullmannite-Willyamite Series. The S analogue of kvačekite.

results.name: Ulvöspinel
results.description_short:
Ulvöspinel-Qandilite Series.

An oxyspinel that commonly occurs as an exsolution product, forming a fine network along {100} in magnetite, or in ilmenite.

results.name: Umangite
results.description_short: Berzelianite-Umangite Group.

results.name: Umbite
results.description_short: The Zr analogue of kamenevite.

results.name: Umbozerite
results.description_short: Compare UM1990-96-SiO:NaTh, UM2007-47-SiO:HKNaTh, UM2007-48-SiO:HNaSrThTi, and UM2007-49-SiO:HNaSrThTi.

results.name: Uramphite
results.description_short: Meta-autunite Group.  Phosphate analogue of Uramarsite.

results.name: Uraninite
results.description_short:
Uraninite Group. Thorianite-Uraninite Series.

Occurs in granitic and syenitic pegmatites. Colloform crusts in high-temperature hydrothermal veins. In quartz-pebble conglomerates.

Typical uranium ore contains ca. 0.1 mg of Po / metric ton; Ra is m...

results.name: Uranocircite
results.description_short:
Autunite Group.

Dehydrates rapidly in dry atmospheres at normal temperature to metauranocircite (as metauranocircite-I in Walenta, 1963).

results.name: Parauranophane
results.description_short:
Uranophane Group.

May convert to uranophane on crushing.

results.name: Uranophane
results.description_short: Uranophane Group. Compare UM1997-50-SiO:CaHU.

results.name: Uranopilite
results.description_short: May dehydrate to Meta-uranopilite.

results.name: Uranopolycrase
results.description_short:
The uranium analogue of polycrase-(Y). 
Compare also brannerite.

Type material almost totally metamict.

results.name: Uranospathite
results.description_short:
The P analogue of arsenuranospathite. An uncommon secondary mineral occurring in the oxidized zones of uranium-bearing hydrothermal deposits.
Easily loses 10-12 H2O converting to sabugalite (Walenta, 1978).

Crystal structure details:

- corner-sh...

results.name: Uranospinite
results.description_short:
Often as fine-grained waxy to powdery light yellow coatings. Autunite Group.
May dehydrate to metauranospinite. Possible hydronium analogue is UM1997-19-AsO:HU.

A secondary mineral occurring in the oxidized zone of arsenic-bearing and uranium-beari...

results.name: Uranotungstite
results.description_short: Originally assumed to be orthorhombic and having the chemical formula (Fe#2+#,Ba,Pb)(UO^2)^2(WO^4)(OH)^4.12H^2O (Walenta, 1985). A restudy of type material and other material, including a crystal-structure determination, showed the mineral to be in fac...

results.name: Urea
results.description_short:
Derived from bat guano and urine, stable only under very arid conditions.

Chemically identical to an organic compound (an amide) of the identical name.

results.name: Uricite
results.description_short:
Natural uric acid. Anhydrous counterpart of tinnunculite.

2,6,8-trihydroxypurine (a heterocyclic compound, i.e., cyclic organic carbon compound with additional, non-carbon atom(s)) according to the organic chemical nomenclature.

See also the visu...

results.name: Urvantsevite
results.description_short: Compositional similarity to, e.g., polarite and 'UM1981-02-Bi:AsPbPd'.

results.name: Usovite
results.description_short: Compare other Ba-Al fluoride minerals, 'Unnamed (Ba-Al Fluoride Hydroxide)' and 'Unnamed (Ba-analogue of calcioaravaipaite)'.

results.name: Ussingite
results.description_short: The structure is a unique interrupted framework with strong H bonding. It is based on 4-, 6- and 8-membered rings of silicate tetrahedra, somewhat like these in feldspars but, as opposed to the latter, partially depolymerized.

results.name: Ustarasite
results.description_short:
"Ustarasite was defined by Sakharova (1955) on the basis of chemical analysis and X-ray powder data. The mineral is compositionally close to synthetic Phase V of Otto & Strunz (1968), which is ∼PbBi4S7 (lillianite–pavonite super-family).
Unit-cell dat...

results.name: Uvanite
results.description_short: A secondary mineral occurring in asphaltic sandstone in a Colorado Plateau-type uranium deposit.

results.name: Uvarovite
results.description_short:
Garnet Group. Grossular-Uvarovite Series, Andradite-Uvarovite Series

Uvarovite is the name given to the green calcium chromium garnet end member. 
The name has frequently been misused in the past to refer to other green and/or chromium-bearing garn...

results.name: Rhabdoborite-(Mo)
results.description_short:
The (phosphate-deficient) Mo analogue of rhabdoborite-(V) and rhabdoborite-(W). Unique combination of elements. The only mineral with essential Mo and B to date.

Structure determined.

The three rhabdoborite group species form a series.

results.name: Uytenbogaardtite
results.description_short:
May form as exsolutions in (originally Au-bearing) acanthite. Structurally different from (stoichiometrically similar) petzite and fischesserite, although forming a series with the latter. Often found in 0.1mm grains, in clusters. 

Analogous to Cu-b...

results.name: Ushkovite
results.description_short: Occurs as short, striated bladed crystals with acute terminations.

results.name: Vaesite
results.description_short:
Pyrite Group. 
Pyrite-Vaesite Series; Cattierite-Vaesite Series.

results.name: Valleriite
results.description_short:
Valleriite Group.
May be confused with mackinawite.

results.name: Vanadinite
results.description_short: Apatite Group. Apatite Supergroup. The vanadate analogue of Mimetite and Pyromorphite. Forms a solid solution series toward Mimetite (in nature up to approximately V:As = 1:1 - Mimetite-Vanadinite Series) and a complete series with Pyromorphite. Baker ...

results.name: Vandenbrandeite
results.description_short:
Highly stable in the presence of water and H2O2.

"A potential alteration product of spent nuclear fuel" (Frankland et al., 2023).

results.name: Vandendriesscheite
results.description_short: Structurally related to gauthierite.

results.name: Vanmeersscheite
results.description_short: Not to be confused with vandermeersscheite.

results.name: Vantasselite
results.description_short: Structurally similar to vashégyite and matulaite.

results.name: Variscite
results.description_short:
Variscite-Strengite Series. 
The orthorhombic dimorph of Metavariscite.

Pseudo-tetragonal-dipyramidal crystals may be confused with wardite.

The two orthorhombic polytypes, variscite-1O and variscite-2O (Ardit et al., 2022), are known as "Lucin-...

results.name: Varlamoffite
results.description_short: Originally inadequately described from Cerro Rico, Potosi, Bolivia, as "Souxite" by Dr Roberto Herzenberg, who discovered that some of the secondary tin oxide resulting from the oxidation of tin-rich sulphosalts was soluble in acids and therefore was n...

results.name: Varulite
results.description_short: Alluaudite Group, Hagendorfite-Varulite Series.

results.name: Vaterite
results.description_short:
A rare CaCO3 modification that is metastable below approx. 400°C. May be stabilised by sulphate (Fernández-Díaz et al., 2010).

Vaterite is actually composed of at least two different crystallographic structures that coexist within a pseudo–single cr...

results.name: Vauquelinite
results.description_short:
Fornacite-Vauquelinite Series. The phosphate analogue of fornacite.

Related to the Brackebuschite Supergroup.

results.name: Vauxite
results.description_short:
A secondary mineral derived from the alteration of apatite.

Compare also the higher hydrate paravauxite and its dimorph metavauxite.
Ferrivauxite is an oxidized equivalent of vauxite.

results.name: Veatchite
results.description_short:
The three known polytypes of veatchite (1A, 1M, 2M) are described by Grice & Pring (2012).

The SrCa-ordered analogue is called calcioveatchite.

results.name: Veenite
results.description_short:
Dufrénoysite-Veenite Series.

Sartorite homologue, N = 4; the structure is based on zig-zag walls of prismatic [3]Pb; these walls separate slabs comprising diagonally-oriented double layers containing Sb and As, and some Pb. Orientation of three-memb...

results.name: Velikite
results.description_short: Stannite Group.

results.name: Vermiculite
results.description_short:
Forms as an alteration product of biotite or phlogopite, by weathering or hydrothermal action. Vermiculite is mined as a natural insulation material.

The best exfoliation properties were observed not for pure vermiculite, but for intergrowths of ver...

results.name: Vernadite
results.description_short:
According to Giovanoli (1980), vernadite is random-stacked birnessite, however in reply Chukrov & Gorshkov (1980) disagree with this due to the comparison of diffraction data and the absence of transitional forms from birnessite to vernadite.
A modern...

results.name: Versiliaite
results.description_short: Trippkeite Group.

results.name: Vésigniéite
results.description_short: Visually similar to volborthite.

results.name: Veszelyite
results.description_short:
The P analogue of arsenoveszelyite.

A rare secondary Cu-Zn mineral occurring in the oxidised zones of base metal deposits.

results.name: Vigezzite
results.description_short:
Aeschynite Group. The Nb analogue of UM2001-09-O:CaNbREESiTiY.

Compare Fersmite.

results.name: Viitaniemiite
results.description_short: The Ca analogue of kiryuite.

results.name: Villamanínite
results.description_short:
Pyrite Group.

See also fukuchilite.

results.name: Villiaumite
results.description_short:
The Na analogue of carobbiite.

Water-soluble and toxic!

According to Calas et al. (2021) the red colour comes from metal Na nanoparticles, 2.5–3 nm in diameter. Similar nanoparticles impart blue colour to halite.

results.name: Villyaellenite
results.description_short:
Compare giftgrubeite, the ordered (Ca:Mn = 3:2) intermediate member between villyaellenite and sainfeldite.

See also the closely related miguelromeroite. Note: The miguelromeroite samples from the Veta Negra mine, Chile, were originally labeled "vil...

results.name: Vincentite
results.description_short: Compare, e.g., UM1993-02-AsTe:Pd.

results.name: Violarite
results.description_short:
Linnaeite Group and Thiospinel Group.
Siegenite-Violarite Series.

results.name: Virgilite
results.description_short: Naturally occurring high-temperature solid solution between beta-quartz and spodumene (LiAlSi2O6).

results.name: Vishnevite
results.description_short: Cancrinite Group. The sulphate analogue of Cancrinite and Hydroxycancrinite.

results.name: Vismirnovite
results.description_short: Schoenfliesite Group.

results.name: Vitusite-(Ce)
results.description_short:
May be altered to "erikite" = a pseudomorphous mixture of monazite and rhabdophane after vitusite-(Ce) (Pekov et al., 1997).

Related to dyrnaesite-(La).

results.name: Vivianite
results.description_short:
Vivianite Group. Forms a series with, e.g., parasymplesite (vivianite-parasymplesite series).

Usually found as deep blue to deep bluish green prismatic to flattened crystals, most crystals rather small to microscopic, larger ones rather rare. 

Wh...

results.name: Vladimirite
results.description_short:
The originally proposed formula Ca5(AsO4)2(HAsO4)2.5H2O was revised by the work of Yang et al. (2011).  

A triclinic compound with the formula Ca5(AsO4)2(HAsO4)2.5H2O was obtained by dehydration of ferrarisite (Catti & Ivaldi, 1981).

results.name: Vlasovite
results.description_short:
Seems to be related to khurayyimite"; the two are suggesteed to belong to the same group.

The two minerals can be described using geometrical repeat unit of cTr = 2T4 3T4 and topological repeat unit of cVr = 2V2 3V2.

results.name: Voglite
results.description_short:
A secondary mineral formed from the alteration of Uraninite. 

Easily confused with liebigite (Axelrod et al. 1951).

results.name: Volborthite
results.description_short:
A secondary mineral found in the oxidized zones of vanadium-bearing hydrothermal deposits.

At least two different monoclinic space-group variants (C2/m, C2/c) seem to be stable at ambient temperature.

Visually similar to vésigniéite.
Structurall...

results.name: Volkonskoite
results.description_short: Smectite Group.

results.name: Volkovskite
results.description_short: Structurally related to Veatchite.

results.name: Voltaite
results.description_short:
Voltaite Group. The Fe2+ analogue of magnesiovoltaite, and K-Fe2+ analogue of ammoniomagnesiovoltaite.

Belongs to a group of ferrous-ferric sulfate minerals, together with bílinite, copiapite, römerite (purely Fe minerals), metavoltine, and pertliki...

results.name: Volynskite
results.description_short:
Matildite Group.

According to Zav'yalov (1985), volynskite is isostructural with bohdanowiczite. 

Compare 'UM1984-40-Te:AgBi', 'UM1986-65-Te:AgBi', and 'Unnamed (Ag-Bi Telluride)' - the chemically related species.

results.name: Vonsenite
results.description_short:
Ludwigite Group. Ludwigite-Vonsenite Series. The Fe2+ analogue of Ludwigite.

A high-temperature mineral occurring in contact metamorphic deposits.

results.name: Vozhminite
results.description_short: Chemically related to heazlewoodite.

results.name: Vuorelainenite
results.description_short: Manganochromite-Vuorelainenite Series.

results.name: Vyalsovite
results.description_short: The optic sign of vyalsovite changes four times within the range of reflectivity measurements..

results.name: Väyrynenite
results.description_short: The manganese-beryllium-phosphate väyrynenite was first recognized in 1939 as a possible new mineral by Oleg von Knorring (1915-1994). However, it was first described as a new mineral by Volborth (1954), from Viitaniemi, Eräjärvi, Finland. Additional m...

results.name: Vysotskite
results.description_short: Braggite-Vysotskite Series.

results.name: Vyuntspakhkite-(Y)
results.description_short: A very rare yttrium mineral in pegmatites.

results.name: Vesuvianite
results.description_short: Hydroxyl analogue of Fluorvesuvianite. The Fe3+ (in site Y1; Panikorovskii et al., 2017) analogue of Alumovesuvianite and Manganvesuvianite.

results.name: Wadalite
results.description_short: Related to IMA2014-028.

results.name: Wadeite
results.description_short: Possible Ti analogue is known as UM1989-35-SiO:KTi.

results.name: Wadsleyite
results.description_short: The orthorhombic, high-pressure polymorph of Ringwoodite and Forsterite (a member of the Olivine group of minerals). Initially found in the Peace River meteorite (from Alberta, Canada), it is thought to be formed from the transformation of Olivine duri...

results.name: Zaykovite
results.description_short: First approved rhodium selenide mineral (compare UM2007-33-Se:CuRhS). The Se analogue of kingstonite. Structurally a bit different that its potential chemical (Ni) analogue, wilkmanite.

results.name: Wagnerite
results.description_short:
Wagnerite Group.

Several polytypes are known. The most common one is wagnerite-Ma2bc. 

 We show that wagnerite and the 5b_0, 7b_0 and 9b_0 phases share the same topological arrangement of cations and oxygen atoms, differ only by the periodic faul...

results.name: Wairakite
results.description_short: Zeolite Group. Analcime-Wairakite Series.

results.name: Wairauite
results.description_short: Compare 'UM1983-05-E:CoFe'.

results.name: Wakefieldite-(Ce)
results.description_short:
Xenotime Group.
The Ce analogue of wakefieldite-(Y), wakefieldite-(La) and wakefieldite-(Nd).

A solid solution involving Ce- and Y-dominant wakefieldite was recently found, together with As-rich xenotime-(Y), as a probable secondary mineral in sili...

results.name: Wakefieldite-(Y)
results.description_short:
Xenotime Group.
The Y analogue of wakefieldite-(Ce), wakefieldite-(La) and wakefieldite-(Nd).

results.name: Walentaite
results.description_short:
Unique combination of elements. One of 3 known minerals with arsenate and phosphate anions occupying separate structural positions (compare machatschkiite and epifanovite).

Compare natrowalentaite.

Walentaite has been redefined and shown to have ...

results.name: Wallisite
results.description_short: Hatchite-Wallisite Series.

results.name: Wallkilldellite
results.description_short: The Mn analogue of Wallkilldellite-(Fe).

results.name: Walstromite
results.description_short: The Ba analogue of margarosanite. Chemically similar to macdonaldite which, however, is basic and contains water.

results.name: Wardite
results.description_short:
Wardite Group.
The Al analogue of cyrilovite and the OH analogue of fluorowardite.

May be confused with pseudo-tetragonal-dipyramidal varieites of variscite.

results.name: Warikahnite
results.description_short: Note: Some "warikahnites" (yellow prisms associated with Cu-bearing adamite and olivenite sprays) recently (late 1980s and later) sold turned out to be willemites. This material is similar to that shown in http://www.mindat.org/photo-174225.html and ht...

results.name: Warwickite
results.description_short: Initially found as small, rough, prismatic crystals in white Franklin marble.

results.name: Watanabeite
results.description_short:
See also Unnamed (Sb-analogue of Watanabeite).

Chemically and structurally related to tennantite/tetraedrite.

results.name: Watkinsonite
results.description_short:
Cu-analog of litochlebite. Closely related to luxembourgite.

Structurally related to berryite.

results.name: Wavellite
results.description_short: A secondary mineral found most often in aluminous, low-grade metamorphic rocks. Usually found as radiating "starburst" clusters of green to yellow-green fibrous crystals on fracture surfaces in the matrix, these may grade into globular aggregates; more...

results.name: Wawayandaite
results.description_short: Only a very few specimens of this chemically unusual species are known.

results.name: Waylandite
results.description_short:
The Al analogue of zaïrite and the phosphate analogue of arsenowaylandite. Unique combination of elements.

Compare 'UM1972-05-BiO:AlCaP'.

results.name: Weddellite
results.description_short: Authigenic in bottom sediments and peat; in calcareous lacustrine sediments; also formed by reaction of calcite with oxalic acid derived from lichens; also from solutions derived from bat guano. Known as component of human urinary stones. May also be p...

results.name: Wegscheiderite
results.description_short:
Chemically related to nahcolite; also similar to trona, 'UM1974-04-CO:HNa'.

In chemistry, the synthetic equivalent is called Wegscheider salt.

results.name: Weilerite
results.description_short:
Originally considered a synonym of arsenogorceixite, because the exact sulphate content was unknown. It was redefined in 1987.

An iron(III) analogue is known: Unnamed (Fe-analogue of Weilerite and Ba-analogue of Oberwolfachite).

results.name: Weilite
results.description_short: White powdery surface alteration of haidingerite.

results.name: Weinebeneite
results.description_short: Weinebeneite is a zeolite with a crystal structure related to that of nabesite. As such, it is also to be compared with pahasapaite, wilancookite, and likely limousinite.

results.name: Weishanite
results.description_short: A gold amalgam. Compare Unnamed (Ag-Au Amalgam), Unnamed (Ag-Au Amalgam II), UM1981-04-E:AgAuHg.

results.name: Weissbergite
results.description_short:
Chemically, the Sb analogue of (monoclinic) lorándite.
Compare the closely related drechslerite (with As-Sb ordering in the crystal structure).

results.name: Weloganite
results.description_short: Donnayite Group.

results.name: Welshite
results.description_short:
Aenigmatite Group.

The only non-centrosymmetric member of the sapphirine group.

results.name: Wendwilsonite
results.description_short:
Roselite Group, Roselite-Wendwilsonite Series. 

The magnesium analogue of Roselite.

results.name: Wenkite
results.description_short: Zeolite Group. Gmelinite-Offretite Subgroup.

results.name: Werdingite
results.description_short: Werdingite was first described from the Bok se Puts Farm, South Africa by Moore et al. (1990). However, the mineral was first observed by the french mineralogist Alfred Lacroix in material collected at Cap Andrahomana, Madagascar (Lacroix 1922).  He de...

results.name: Wermlandite
results.description_short: This is a genuinely rare species. Almost all specimens labeled "wermlandite" prove to be pyroaurite on analysis.

results.name: Wheatleyite
results.description_short: The second Na-Cu oxalate mineral after antipinite (that also contains K). Compare other Cu-bearing oxalate minerals - middlebackite, moolooite, and fiemmeite.

results.name: Whewellite
results.description_short: A rare low-temperature primary hydrothermal mineral in carbonate-sulphide veins; also occurs in geodes, or septarian nodules; associated with coal measures and surrounding rocks with organic material; in some uranium deposits. As microscopic crystals i...

results.name: Whiteite-(CaFeMg)
results.description_short: Whiteite Subgroup.

results.name: Whiteite-(CaMnMg)
results.description_short: Whiteite Subgroup.

results.name: Whiteite-(MnFeMg)
results.description_short: Whiteite Subgroup.

results.name: Whitlockite
results.description_short:
Whitlockite Group.
Structurally related to wopmayite. 

All non-terrestrial whitlockites are actually merrillite (Dowty, 1977).

results.name: Whitmoreite
results.description_short: Arthurite Group. The phosphate analogue of Bendadaite. The mineral ranges from golden-yellow to dark red-brown. The mineral is mostly found as open crystal sprays often with a central sphere-like nucleous and ordinarily lighter than the the sprays.

results.name: Wickenburgite
results.description_short: Monteregianite-(Y)-Wickenburgite Series (as such, probably belongs to rhodesite group). Chemically similar to maricopaite and 'UM1985-25-SiO:AlCaMgPb'.

results.name: Wickmanite
results.description_short: Schoenfliesite Group. The Ge analogue (unnamed) is described by Geier & Ottemann (1970) (see 'UM1970-16-OH:GeMn').

results.name: Wicksite
results.description_short: Wicksite Group. The M(3)Fe analogue of maneckiite. A possible Mn analogue is coded as 'UM1985-09-PO:CaFeHMn'.

results.name: Wilcoxite
results.description_short: Soluble in cold water. Will dissolve in its own crystal water if only slightly heated ("Crystals dissolve in their water of crystallisation, if they are illuminated with a hot or bright light source under the microscope.", Williams & Cesbron, 1983).

results.name: Wilhelmvierlingite
results.description_short: Overite Group.

results.name: Wilkinsonite
results.description_short: Aenigmatite Group. The supposed Mg analogue is known as UM1991-29-SiO:FeMgNa.

results.name: Wilkmanite
results.description_short: Compare zaykovite.

results.name: Willemite
results.description_short:
Phenakite Group.

Crystals prismatic, both stout and slender, terminated by rhombohedra and {0001}, to 20 cm. Commonly tiny simple hexagonal prisms or radial tufts of acicular needles outside of the New Jersey occurrences. Coarse to finely granular, ...

results.name: Willemseite
results.description_short: Ni end-member of the Pyrophyllite-Talc Group.

results.name: Willhendersonite
results.description_short: Zeolite Group. Chabazite-Levyne Subgroup.

results.name: Willyamite
results.description_short:
Cobaltite Group. Ullmannite-Willyamite Series.

Compare costibite and paracostibite, both CoSbS.

results.name: Winchite
results.description_short:
Compare the chemically similar richterite.

The Kajlidongri mine, Madhya Pradesh, India, is generally considered to be the type locality for winchite, but since Fe3+ >> Al the mineral composition of the mineral found here corresponds to a ferri-winch...

results.name: Witherite
results.description_short:
The Ba analogue of strontianite and aragonite.

Found in low-temperature hydrothermal vein deposits. 

Compare 'UM1974-03-CO:BaCaMg'.

Note on the type locality: 
It was for a long time assumed to be Alston Moor, Eden, Cumbria, but Cotterell (20...

results.name: Wittichenite
results.description_short: The BiS analogue of bytízite. Chemically the Bi analogue of skinnerite (pseudo-orthorhombic).

results.name: Wodginite
results.description_short:
Related to ixiolite and rossovskyite.

See also "wolframowodginite".

results.name: Wöhlerite
results.description_short: First described by Scheerer (1843) from several syenite pegmatites in Langesundsfjorden, Norway, among them Løvøya. The exact type locality is not known, but since Løvøya was mentioned specially by Scheerer (1843) this island has become listed as the t...

results.name: Wolfeite
results.description_short: Triploidite-Wolfeite Series. The Fe2+ analogue of Triploidite.

results.name: Wonesite
results.description_short: Mica Group.

results.name: Woodhouseite
results.description_short:
The Ca analogue of svanbergite.

A secondary mineral found where sulphatic argillic wall rock alteration occurred in hydrothermal and disseminated ore deposits; rare in cave deposits.

results.name: Woodruffite
results.description_short: At the type locality, found "chiefly as masses and crusts with a botryoidal surface and a concentric, coarsely layered internal structure. The material is very fine-grained and is opaque in crushed grains. Occasionally, corroded crystals of franklinite...

results.name: Woodwardite
results.description_short:
See also hydrowoodwardite.
Compare also the chemically similar chalcoalumite.

results.name: Wroewolfeite
results.description_short: A rare copper sulphate hydrate that generally forms at low temperatures (Yoder et al., 2007). Compare also posnjakite.

results.name: Wüstite
results.description_short:
Periclase Group.

Occurs mainly in meteorites and anthropogenic slags.

results.name: Wülfingite
results.description_short: One of the most simple Zn minerals. In terms of chemistry alone it is the Zn analogue of spertiniite (both are orthorhombic but structurally are different).

results.name: Wurtzite
results.description_short:
Wurtzite Group.

Usually found as black to dark reddish-brown massive resinous to sub-metallic material, also as botryoidal banded crusts, and more rarely as hemimorphic pyramidal, or tabular, crystals.
Several polytypes are known; the hexagonal 2H ...

results.name: Wyartite
results.description_short:
Wyartite is unique in being the first recognized mineral with pentavalent uranium, beside containing typical hexavalent one in the form of uranyl groups. The other minerals sharing this feature are richetite, shinkolobweite, and nollmotzite.

The str...

results.name: Wyllieite
results.description_short: Wyllieite Group. Ferrowyllieite-Wyllieite Series, and the Rosemaryite-Wyllieite Series.

results.name: Wulfenite
results.description_short:
Stolzite-Wulfenite Series.

A secondary mineral typically found as thin tabular crystals with a bright orange-red, yellow-orange, yellow or yellowish grey colour in the oxidised zones of hydrothermal lead deposits.

In unique situations, it may pre...

results.name: Wollastonite
results.description_short:
Several triclinic and monoclinic polytypes are known.

Visually very similar to dalnegorskite and other members of the wollastonite group. 
May be confused with tremolite, pectolite and others.


The structure of wollastonite contains dreier sing...

results.name: Xanthiosite
results.description_short: An orthorhombic synthetic polymorph is known.

results.name: Xanthoconite
results.description_short:
The monoclinic dimorph of proustite.

The xanthoconite -> proustite transition occurs at 180-202°C (Roland, 1970).

results.name: Xenotime-(Y)
results.description_short:
Xenotime Group. Chernovite-(Y)-Xenotime-(Y) Series. The P (or phosphate) analogue of chernovite-(Y) and wakefieldite-(Y).

The Y analogue of xenotime-(Yb) and xenotime-(Gd).


A recent find of As-rich xenotime-(Y), accompanied by wakefieldite-(Ce)...

results.name: Xiangjiangite
results.description_short: Related to the autunite group.

results.name: Xifengite
results.description_short:
The Fe analogue of mavlyanovite. One of many natural Fe-Si phases; beside the approved species (listed below) you may want to compare Unnamed (Fe silicide I), Unnamed (Fe silicide II) and UM2000-60-Si:Fe.

The Fe(Si)-analogue of wenjiite.

results.name: Xilingolite
results.description_short:
Ramdohrite-Lillianite Group. The monoclinic dimorph of (Ag-free) lillianite.

Compare 'UM1989-22-S:BiPb'.

results.name: Xonotlite
results.description_short: An ino-silicate mineral with double dreier chains. Several polytypes are known (Hejny & Armbruster, 2001): Ma2bc (space group P2/a, a = 17.032, b = 7.363, c = 7.012 Å, β = 90.36°), Ma2b2c (space group A2/a, a = 17.032, b = 7.363, c = 14.023 Å, β = 90.3...

results.name: Xanthoxenite
results.description_short: A secondary mineral resulting from the alteration of triphylite in complex, zoned, granitic pegmatites. Possibly related to minerals of the Jahnsite Group.

results.name: Yafsoanite
results.description_short: Ungrouped member of the Garnet Supergroup.

results.name: Yagiite
results.description_short: Na-dominant member of the osumilite group.

results.name: Yakhontovite
results.description_short: Vivid pistachio-green, yellow-green, or yellow waxy mineral Smectite Group.

results.name: Yanomamite
results.description_short: May be overgrown by an outer zone of white scorodite.

results.name: Yarrowite
results.description_short:
Chalcocite-Yarrowite Series.

See also the closely related spionkopite. Often forms mixtures with anilite, covellite, digenite, djurleite, and/or spionkopite.
A typical intergrowth of yarrowite and spionkopite is called Blaubleibender Covellite.

results.name: Yavapaiite
results.description_short:
Yavapaiite Group.

Related to markhininite.

results.name: Ye'elimite
results.description_short:
Structure related to that of the Sodalite Group.

Well-known as a synthetic component in sulphate-bearing cements. Also found as a product of burning coal dumps (see under "Kruzhevite").
Reacts readily with water.

results.name: Aluminopyracmonite
results.description_short: Closely related to pyracmonite (chemically the ferric Fe analogue; not isostructural). Chemically related to godovikovite; ammonioalunite (basic salt, anhydrous); huizingite-(Al) and tschermigite (hydrated minerals). Admixture of K suggests a solid sol...

results.name: Yimengite
results.description_short:
Does not belong to a subgroup of the magnetoplumbite group.

The Cr analogue of UM1994-08-O:CaFeKMgTi.

Occurrence of a "yimengite isomorphous series" is suggested by Lu & Chou (1994).

results.name: Yingjiangite
results.description_short:
Phosphuranylite Group.

Easily confused with Phosphuranylite. Possibly identical to phosphuranylite (Coutinho and Atencio, 2000; Plášil et al., 2009).

results.name: Yoderite
results.description_short: A major phase in quartz-kyanite-talc schist formed under conditions of ~10 kbar H2O pressure and 800 °C.

results.name: Yofortierite
results.description_short: Compare 'UM1969-14-SiO:FeHMn' - reported from the same environment.

results.name: Yoshimuraite
results.description_short: Compositionally related to zinkgruvanite, i.e., close to being its TiP-, or Ti-PO4-analogue, but with different type of linkages.

results.name: Yoshiokaite
results.description_short:
Compare Unnamed (Ca-Al-(Si) oxide I), Unnamed (Ca-Al-(Si) oxide II), Unnamed (Ca-Al-(Si) oxide III), Unnamed (Ca-Al-(Si) oxide IV) and Unnamed (Ca-Al-Si oxide) - terrestrial phases also connected with high pressures.

Present as shocked crystal fragm...

results.name: Yttrialite-(Y)
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue.
Probably polymorphous with anorthoyttrialite-(Y) (?: confirmation needed).

results.name: Yttrotantalite-(Y)
results.description_short:
A member of the Samarskite Group according to Ercit (2005).

See also Iwashiroite-(Y) and Formanite-(Y).

results.name: Yttrotungstite-(Y)
results.description_short: See also yttrotungstite-(Ce) and yttrotungstite-(Nd).

results.name: Yugawaralite
results.description_short: Zeolite Group. Laumontite Subgroup.

results.name: Yukonite
results.description_short:
Easily confused with Arseniosiderite and identifiable only with XRD methods, although yukonite is frequently amorphous to X-rays.
Paktunc et al. (2015) consider yukonite a "nanocrystalline precursor and Ca-deficient variety of arseniosiderite". King e...

results.name: Yuksporite
results.description_short: Possibly related to Astrophyllite Supergroup

results.name: Yushkinite
results.description_short:
Valleriite Group.

The structure is a "commensurate combination of brucite and sulfide layers".

results.name: Zabuyelite
results.description_short: Has been found as very tiny microscopic colorless inclusions in microscopic fluid-bearing inclusions in spodumene.

results.name: Zaherite
results.description_short: Dehydrates reversibly at room temperature.

results.name: Zaïrite
results.description_short:
The ferric iron analogue of waylandite.

The phosphate analogue of Unnamed (As-analogue of Zaïrite).

The Bi (or Bi-PO3OH) analogue of UM2006-23-PO:AlBiCaFeH.

Medium to light olive-green irregular plates.

results.name: Zakharovite
results.description_short:
See also Unnamed (Fe analogue of Zakharovite).

Visually resembles shafranovskite, UM1990-85-SiO:AlCaFeHMnNa, UM1990-89-SiO:CaFFeHKNa, UM1990-93-SiO:FeHNa, and UM1990-94-SiO:FFeHNaTi.

results.name: Zanazziite
results.description_short: Roscherite Group.

results.name: Zaratite
results.description_short:
A secondary nickel carbonate of uncertain and apparently variable composition.
Garcia-Guinea et al. (2014) concluded that "zaratite" should not deserve a species status. Their samples taken from various localities proved to be low-crystalline anhydrou...

results.name: Zavaritskite
results.description_short: Matlockite Group.

results.name: Zektzerite
results.description_short: Tuhualite Group.

results.name: Zemannite
results.description_short:
Zn-analogue of kinichilite and keystoneite. Fe-analogue of ilirneyite. 
According to Mandarino et al. (1976) zemannite has zeolite-like framework of negatively charged [Zn^2(TeO^3)^3], with large channels parallel to [0001].

results.name: Zemkorite
results.description_short:
The Na analogue of fairchildite. There is likely a solid solution between the two species, as suggested by the empirical formula of the current species.

There are a few synthetic HP chemically close compounds, e.g., 'Unnamed (Na-Ca Carbonate I)'.

results.name: Zenzénite
results.description_short: Isostructural with synthetic Pb3Mn7O15.

results.name: Zeunerite
results.description_short:
Autunite Group.

A secondary mineral occurring in the oxidised zones of arsenic-bearing hydrothermal uranium deposits.
Easily dehydrates to Metazeunerite.

results.name: Zhanghengite
results.description_short:
Brass group.

Compare danbaite and α-Brass.

results.name: Zhemchuzhnikovite
results.description_short: The Al analogue of stepanovite. Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Ziesite
results.description_short: Compare 'UM1980-18-VO:Cu'.

results.name: Zimbabweite
results.description_short: An arsenite-tantalate.

results.name: Zinc
results.description_short:
Zinc Group.

As mm-sized irregular plates with cross-hatched striations and hummocky surfaces. A single particle from the Lunar regolith is ca. 1 micron in diameter.

Note: most of the localities listed here, notably those with "slag" or "smelter" ...

results.name: Zincmelanterite
results.description_short:
Melanterite Group. 

Dehydrates readily under ambient conditions.

results.name: Zinczippeite
results.description_short: The zinc analogue of zippeite.

results.name: Zincaluminite
results.description_short:
A questionable mineral with undetermined X-ray powder pattern and unknown crystallography. Compare also zincowoodwardite.

Note: a SEM-EDS analysis of a typical "zincaluminite" specimen from the Genna zinc smelter slag locality, Letmathe (there are s...

results.name: Zincite
results.description_short: NOTE: synthetic zincite crystals are widespread on the mineral market, e.g., https://www.gia.edu/gems-gemology/spring-2017-characteristics-gem-quality-synthetic-zincite

results.name: Zincobotryogen
results.description_short:
The Zn analogue of botryogen. The higher hydrate counterpart of chaidamuite. Chemically similar to zincocopiapite and somehow to lishizhenite. A very rare secondary Zn-Fe(III) sulphate formed in the oxidation zone.  
Orginally described as a new miner...

results.name: Zincochromite
results.description_short: Spinel Group. The zinc analogue of Chromite.

results.name: Zincocopiapite
results.description_short: Copiapite Group

results.name: Zincrosasite
results.description_short:
Rosasite Group. 
Reinvestigation by modern methods needed. The crystal structure of its Cu analogue, rosasite, has been solved by Perchiazzi (2006). 
Fehér et al. (2015) argue that the "zincrosasite" insufficiently described by Strunz (1959) and mate...

results.name: Zincroselite
results.description_short: Roselite Group. The zinc analogue of Roselite.

results.name: Zincsilite
results.description_short:
Smectite Group. 
A tetrasilicic member of the smectite group. When Al(IV) substitutes for Si(IV), charge imbalance requires an interlayer cation and the mineral may grade toward sauconite.

results.name: Zinkenite
results.description_short:
The structure contains interconnected SbS3 groups, also observed in, e.g., boulangerite, jamesonite, and robinsonite.

See also UM1986-35-S:AsBiPbSb.

results.name: Zinkosite
results.description_short: Probably an artificial product, and its occurence in nature (at least at its "type locality") is doubtful (Calvo and Viñals, 2008).

results.name: Zippeite
results.description_short:
NOTE: Many of the specimens that are labeled "zippeite" are actually natrozippeite (the sodium-dominant member of the group), especially those from sedimentary deposits.

Structurally related to redcanyonite.

results.name: Zircon
results.description_short:
Zircon Group. The zirconium analogue of Thorite and Hafnon. Zircon-Hafnon Series. The low-pressure dimorph of Reidite.

Zircon, zirconium orthosilicate, is found in most igneous rocks and some metamorphic rocks as small crystals or grains, mostly wid...

results.name: Zirconolite
results.description_short:
A complex zirconium titanium oxide with three polytypoids known (2M, 3O, 3T). 

Gieré et al. (1998) identified five hypothetical end-members, CaZrTi2O7, CaZrMe5+Me3+O7, ACTZrTiMe2+O7, REEZrTiMe3+O7 and REEZrMe5+Me2+O7.
The last one has been observed...

results.name: Zircophyllite
results.description_short:
Astrophyllite Group.

The currently accepted formula is K2NaFe2+7Zr2(Si4O12)2O2(OH)4F.

results.name: Zircosulfate
results.description_short: Found at the TL as a white crust or powder in a weathered sulphide-bearing pegmatite. Probably formed as a result of alteration of eudialyte by sulphate solutions.

results.name: Zirkelite
results.description_short:
Black grains or masses, rarely as simple to complex isometric crystals.

Compare the chemically related zirconolite.

results.name: Zirsinalite
results.description_short: Lovozerite Group

results.name: Znucalite
results.description_short: The layered structure is based on [Zn10(OH)14(CO3)2] double sheet, with both octahedral and tetrahedral Zn. The thick interlayer bears Ca ions and uranyl and water groups. Ordering of Ca and U varies which is suggested to cause issues with solving the ...

results.name: Zodacite
results.description_short: Ferric iron analogue of fanfaniite.

results.name: Zoisite
results.description_short: Formerly assigned to the Epidote Group. Since Zoisite is the  orthorhombic polymorph of Clinozoisite, zoisite is no longer considered a member of this group, according to the new nomenclature of the Epidote Supergroup  (Armbruster et al., 2006; Mills e...

results.name: Zorite
results.description_short:
The structure of Zorite contains double dreier chains of (SiO4) tetrahedra, which are linked by Ti cations into a three-dimensional framework. 
A topologically identical framework is found in the structures of Haineaultite (the Ca-analogue of Zorite),...

results.name: Zoubekite
results.description_short:
Compositionally related to Owyheeite and UM1990-32-S:AgPbSb.

Crystal study unknown. A modern restudy seems necessary.

results.name: Zussmanite
results.description_short:
Fe2+-analogue of Coombsite.

Dark green micaceous mineral in stilpnomelane and quartz gneiss. A modulated phyllosilicate.

results.name: Zvyagintsevite
results.description_short: Compare 'UM1970-09-E:PbPdPtSn'.

results.name: Zwieselite
results.description_short:
Triplite-Zwieselite Series. 
The Fe2+ analogue of Triplite.

results.name: Zýkaite
results.description_short:
Sanjuanite-Destinezite Group.

Chemically related to Bukovskýite.

results.name: Zincovoltaite
results.description_short: Voltaite Group.

results.name: Cuproauride
results.description_short: Identical to auricupride ?

results.name: Pertsevite-(F)
results.description_short: F-analogue of Pertsevite-(OH).

results.name: Katayamalite
results.description_short: Described as the hydroxyl analogue of baratovite, which had originally been described as fluor-dominant. Some mineralogists now claim that baratovite is also hydroxyl- rather than fluor-dominant, and that baratovite and katayamalite are therefore the s...

results.name: Renardite
results.description_short: Described as a new species from Shinkolobwe, Democratic Republic of Congo by Schoep (1928). Later Deliens et al. (1990) argued that it was a mixture of dewindtite and phosphuranylite. Sejkora et al. (2003) investigated specimens from  Rýžoviště, Haarac...

results.name: Destinezite
results.description_short:
Sanjuanite-Destinezite Group.

Destinezite was redefined (IMA Code 00-E) as triclinic Fe2(PO4)(SO4)(OH)·6H2O, the crystalline counterpart of the amorphous diadochite.

Structurally related to arangasite.

results.name: Emilite
results.description_short:
Aikinite-Bismuthinite Series.

Compare 'UM1984-23-S:BiCuPb'.

results.name: Merrillite
results.description_short:
Mg-dominant analogue of ferromerrillite. Na analogue of keplerite.

Merrillite was revalidated as a valid species in 1976.
Merrill (1915) described the mineral from (at least) 4 meteorites, which may be considered type localities: Alfianello, Dhurms...

results.name: Akimotoite
results.description_short: Ilmenite Group. A high-pressure phase and the Mg-analogue of hemleyite and the Si-analogue of geikielite.

results.name: Aluminoceladonite
results.description_short: Mica Group.

results.name: Taramite
results.description_short:
Taramite is defined as a taramite-group member with Na>K in the A position, Mg>Fe2+ and Al>Fe3+ in the C position. Taramite has been redefined in the 2012 Amphibole nomenclature in that:

1) The formula is changed from Na(NaCa)(Mg3AlFe3+)(Al2Si6O22)(...

results.name: Alumoklyuchevskite
results.description_short: The recent structure refinement is done by Siidra et al. (2016). The structure may be understood as an example of "host-guest" principle, an this is attributable to other Cu oxysulphate minerals.

results.name: Ancylite-(La)
results.description_short: The La analogue of ancylite-(Ce). The Sr analogue of calcioancylite-(La) and gysinite-(La).

results.name: Manganiandrosite-(La)
results.description_short:
A member of the Allanite Subgroup of the Epidote Group.
Manganiakasakaite-(La)-Manganiandrosite-(La) Series.

results.name: Andyrobertsite
results.description_short:
The Cd analogue of calcioandyrobertsite.

Structurally related to the Lavendulan Group.

results.description_short: May be confused with mawbyite and carminite, which are also Pb-Fe-arsenates, but with a much lower Pb content.

results.name: Babkinite
results.description_short: Aleksite Group.

results.name: Baksanite
results.description_short: Compare also Unnamed (Bi Sulphide) and Unnamed (Bi4TeS5).

results.name: Bariosincosite
results.description_short:
The barium analogue of sincosite.

Some samples from the type locality are rich in Sr (Uwe Kolitsch, unpubl. data), thus indicating that the Sr analogue may also occur in nature.

results.name: Bederite
results.description_short: Wicksite Group.

results.name: Belovite-(La)
results.description_short: A mineral in the Belovite Group of the Apatite Supergroup. The lanthanum analogue of belovite-(Ce). The NaSr3La analogue of fluorapatite.

results.name: Benyacarite
results.description_short:
A K-dominant end-member (probably new mineral) was reported by Sejkora et al. (2006).

Compare also paulkerrite and mantienneite.

results.name: Blatonite
results.description_short:
A secondary uranium mineral.
Chemically, simple uranyl(VI) carbonate monohydrate.

results.name: Boralsilite
results.description_short: First anhydrous Al-B-silicate to be discovered in nature. At Stornes Peninsula the borasilite may be partly replaced by diaspore.

results.description_short:

results.name: Brewsterite-Ba
results.description_short: Zeolite Group. The barium analogue of brewsterite-Sr.

results.name: Brewsterite-Sr

results.name: Brianroulstonite
results.description_short: The Cl (or Cl2) analogue of popugaevaite.

results.name: Calcioandyrobertsite
results.description_short:
The Ca analogue of andyrobertsite.

1M and 2O polytypes are known, and they were originally approved separately as IMA1997-022 and IMA2000-011, respectively. Type locality for both is Tsumeb. 

Structurally related to the Lavendulan Group.

results.name: Caresite
results.description_short: Only known as 3T polytype

results.name: Carmichaelite
results.description_short: Compare 'UM1987-04-O:Ti' and tistarite.

results.name: Kupletskite-(Cs)
results.description_short:
Astrophyllite Group.
Kupletskite-Kupletskite-(Cs) Series. 
The cesium analogue of kupletskite.

results.name: Chabazite-Ca
results.description_short:
The calcium-dominant member of the Chabazite series of the Zeolite Group. 
The most common member of this series.

results.name: Chabazite-K
results.description_short: The potassium dominant member of the Chabazite series of the Zeolite Group.

results.name: Chabazite-Na
results.description_short:

results.name: Silvialite
results.description_short: Sulphate-dominant member of the Scapolite Group.

results.name: Simmonsite
results.description_short: Found as lumps (to > 2 cm) of cloudy white interlocking grains which may or may not have a distinct graular appearance. Simmonsite may be distinguished from the many other aluminofluorides with which it may be associated by its orange fluorescence in S...

results.name: Smrkovecite
results.description_short: Atelestite Group.

results.name: Sorosite
results.description_short: Chemically similar minerals are also 'bronze', 'UM1978-02-E:CuPbSn', and 'UM1985-05-E:CuSn'.

results.name: Sphaerobismoite
results.description_short: The natural analogue of beta-Bi^2O^3. A polymorph of bismite.

results.name: Stanĕkite
results.description_short:
Wagnerite Group.

Two polytypes are known: Ma2bc (type material) and Mabc (space group I2/a; Keller et al., 2005).

results.name: Stilbite-Ca
results.description_short:
Zeolite Group.

See also the chemically similar Stellerite and Stilbite-Na.
Note: stilbite-Ca and stilbite-Na are monoclinic (pseudo-orthorhombic), in contrast to the chemically similar Stellerite, which is orthorhombic.

results.name: Stilbite-Na
results.description_short:
Zeolite Group.

Note: due to the high Na content, the monoclinic C2/m symmetry of stilbite is retained, in contrast to the chemically similar, but Na-free stellerite which is orthorhombic.

results.name: Stoppaniite
results.description_short: Found in miarolitic cavities in syenite ejecta in pyroclastic breccia, Capranica, Viterbo.

results.name: Strontiomelane
results.description_short: Coronadite Group.  Many manganese oxides are better identified using infra-red spectroscopy than by x-ray diffraction because of issues of crystal size, disorder, etc. (Potter and Rossman, 1979).

results.name: Ferro-holmquistite
results.description_short: Ferro-holmquistite forms a series with holmquistite. Like holmquistite, ferro-holmquistite is almost exclusively formed in the reaction zone between Li-pegmatites and their host rock, predominantly as a metasomatic alteration product of pre-existing am...

results.name: Tainiolite
results.description_short:
Mica Group.
K analogue of garmite.

1M, 2M1, 3A polytypes.

results.name: Tantalcarbide
results.description_short: The Ta analogue of niobocarbide. Unique combination of elements: the only Ta-C mineral known.

results.name: Tantalowodginite
results.description_short: At the type locality, Emmons pegmatite, tantalowodginite is rimmed with either black wodginite or columbite-(Mn).

results.name: Ternesite
results.description_short: Isotypic with "silicocarnotite."

results.name: Terranovaite
results.description_short:

Terranovaite, ...

results.name: Tetraferriannite
results.description_short: Mica Group. The ferric iron analogue of annite and ferrous iron analogue of tetraferriphlogopite.

Mica Group.
Polylithionite-Trilithionite Series.

results.name: Tschörtnerite
results.description_short: Zeolite Group. The only currently known natural representative of the group with copper as an essential cation.

Cl/(Cl+S) is similar to that in pillaite and pellouxite; and slightly higher than that show...

results.name: Vanadomalayaite

The vanadium (V4+) analogue of titanite and malayaite.

results.name: Vuoriyarvite-K

results.name: Wiluite
results.description_short: Vesuvianite Group.

results.name: Wooldridgeite
results.description_short:
The second diphosphate (pyrophosphate) to be discovered, probably a post-mining/post-collecting anthropogenic alteration.

Synthetic woooldridgeite can be made simply using a solution of copper and calcium ions to which the commercial pyrophospate-ba...

results.name: Xenotime-(Yb)
results.description_short: Xenotime Group.

results.name: Yttrotungstite-(Ce)
results.description_short:
See also Yttrotungstite-(Y) and Unnamed (Nd-analogue of Yttrotungstite-(Ce)).

results.description_short: Högbomite Group.

results.description_short:
Natural analogue of synthetic clathrate MTN with hydrocarbon molecules such as methane, ethane, propane, and 2-methyl-propane contained in its cage-like voids.

Also described as a clathrasil. Compare the other natural clathrasils: bosoite and melano...

results.name: Charmarite
results.description_short: Found as the polytypes charmarite-2H and charmarite-3T.

results.name: Biehlite
results.description_short:

results.name: Pertsevite-(OH)
results.description_short: The OH-analogue of pertsevite-(F).

Samarskite Group.

results.name: Tsilaisite
results.description_short:

1952 described as a new mineral, 1982 discredited as a strontian variety of tyretskite, 2000 revalidated and approved by the IMA.

results.description_short:
Isotypic with ternesite. A member of the ternesite-silicocarnotite solid solution. Chemically similar to nagelschmidtite and 'ciplyite'.

results.description_short: Magnesium formate dihydrate.

results.description_short: Mica Group. The fluorine analogue of annite and the Fe2+ analogue of fluorophlogopite. Also the K analogue of UM2003-27-SiO:AlCsFFeHLi.

results.name: Redgillite
results.description_short:
A copper sulphate visually similar to malachite.

results.description_short:
Not to be confused with vanadio-oxy-dravite. 
Related to oxy-dravite and oxy-chromium-dravite by the homovalent substitution V3+ → Al and V3+ → Cr3+ (respectively) at the Y and Z sites. 

Note:
"The occurrence of solid-solutions among V3+, Cr3+, an...

results.name: Bradaczekite
results.description_short: Alluaudite Group. The Cu (or rather Cu4) analogue of zincobradaczekite.

results.name: Kampfite
results.description_short: Part of the Monteregianite-(Y)-Wickenburgite Series.

results.description_short: Related to lapeyreite.

results.description_short: Chemically related to CCUK-15.

results.name: Rinmanite

results.name: Kleberite
results.description_short:
Chemically similar to 'Hydroxylian Pseudorutile'.

results.description_short:
The Zn analogue of Woodwardite.

The Sc analogue of silesiaite.

results.name: Hoganite
results.description_short:
A very rare naturally formed copper acetate.
See also the associated paceite.

results.description_short:
The Fe analogue of shigaite and poellmannite.

May be confused with clinochlore and chamosite.

results.name: Oxy-dravite
results.description_short:
Tourmaline Group.

Oxy-dravite has been used as a preliminary working name for a much-studied new member of the tourmaline group which has already appeared several times in the mineralogical literature. It was submitted and approved as a new species ...

results.name: Pararsenolamprite
results.description_short: Sb-bearing polymorph of native arsenic and arsenolamprite. Unlike normal native arsenic, stable in the atmosphere. Found with stibnite on mammillary arsenic in quartz vein from a hydrothermal Ag-Au mine.

results.description_short: Chemically similar to nickeltalmessite and nickelaustinite.

results.description_short: Pizgrischite belongs to the cuprobismutite series of bismuth sulfosalts but, sensu stricto, it is not a homologue of cuprobismutite.

results.description_short: A polysomatic Högbomite Group mineral composed of two nolanite modules (N) and two spinel modules (S) where the spinel modules have ideally hercynite composition.

results.description_short: Compare UM1990-99-SiO:BaCaFFeHMnNaSrTi.

results.description_short:
Calcioursilite was originally described in 1957 as “ursilite” (now discredited) from the Oktyabr’skoye deposit, Kyzyltyube-Saj, Samgar Steppe, Tajikistan.

results.name: Aradite

results.description_short:
Structurally, an expanded derivative of owyheeite. Also has quasi-homeotypic relationships with sterryite and parasterryite; and related to ciriottiite.

results.name: Schizolite

results.name: Nickeltsumcorite

results.name: Kuratite
results.description_short: The Fe2+-analogue of rhönite.

results.name: Canutite

Perovskite-type high-pressure phase. The Mg analogue of hiroseite.

results.name: Saamite

results.name: Misakiite
results.description_short:

The structure is layered and closely related to that of iyoite, which is also closely associated and of the same genesis.

Also synthesized by hydrothermal method.

The structure is layered and closely related to that of the associated and genetically similar misakiite.

Could not be synthesized.

results.name: Ferriakasakaite-(La)
results.description_short: Allanite Group of the Epidote Supergroup. Ferriakasakaite-(La) has a new combination of dominant cations at A1(Ca) and M3(Mn2+), which are the key sites to determine a root name for epidote-supergroup minerals.

results.name: Ferriandrosite-(La)
results.description_short: Ferriandrosite-(La) is the La analogue of ferriandrosite-(Ce) and the M1Fe3+ analogue of androsite.

results.name: Segerstromite

results.name: Steinhardtite
results.description_short: An allotrope of aluminium. Nickel and iron are essential elements.

results.name: Ichnusaite
results.description_short: New structure type. (pronounced iknusa-ait)

results.name: Nuragheite
results.description_short: New structure type. The second thorium molybdate reported in nature.

results.name: Gatedalite
results.description_short: The Mn2+ analogue of skogbyite.

results.name: Okruschite
results.description_short: The arsenate analogue of roscherite. Unique combination of elements.

results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue.

results.description_short: Chemically and structurally similar to akatoreite.

results.name: Kenotobermorite

results.name: Bluestreakite

results.name: Packratite
results.description_short: New structure type.

results.name: Ferriandrosite-(Ce)
results.description_short: The Fe3+ analogue of androsite-(Ce), manganiandrosite-(Ce) and vanadoandrosite-(Ce). The Ce analogue of ferriandrosite-(La) and the Mn2+ (or Mn2+Ce-) analogue of ferriakasakaite-(Ce).

results.name: Bulgakite

results.name: Carlsonite
