Chemically related especially to clairite and lonecreekite; Unnamed (Fe analogue of huizingite-(Al)); also somewhat to mohrite. The first NH4-Fe oxysulphate mineral. Probably has a narrow stability range.

The bipartite structure (related to that of ...

results.name: Fermiite
results.description_short:
Structurally related to meisserite. Also structurally somewhat similar to oppenheimerite.

Chemically related to oppenheimerite, klaprothite, péligotite, ottohahnite; plášilite and natrozippeite (basic salts); belakovskiite and meisserite (sulfate-hy...

results.name: Dyrnaesite-(La)
results.description_short: Structurally related to vitusite-(Ce). Third mineral with tetravalent cerium after cerianite-(Ce) and stetindite. Unique combination of elements; a quite specific feature is also division of REEs into separate structural positions (compare laptevite-(C...

results.name: Mianningite
results.description_short:
Mianningite can be considered as the analogue of mapiquiroite with the M0 site preferentially vacant.
Initially []-dominant mineral of davidite group without special name was described from Kazakhstan (Ryzhov e.a., 1983). Then a poorly characterized m...

results.name: Oppenheimerite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Structurally somewhat similar to fermiite and related to bobcookite.

Chemically related minerals: fermiite, klaprothite, ottohahnite, péligotite; also basic salts plášilite and natrozippeite; and sulfate-hydrosulfates belakovskii...

results.name: Bettertonite
results.description_short:
New structure type, closely related to that of penberthycroftite; both structures are flexible layered type, comprising corner-linked columns of heteropolyhedra.

Chemically similar to liskeardite.

Transforms to penberthycroftyite at relatively lo...

results.name: Lefontite
results.description_short: Related to childrenite and eosphorite.

results.name: Vanderheydenite
results.description_short: New structure type.

results.name: Svornostite
results.description_short:
A low-temperature, supergene mineral formed by the post-mining weathering of uraninite.

The Mg analogue of oldsite.

results.name: Ježekite
results.description_short:
Not to be confused with Ježekite (of Slavik)
A supergene, low-temperature mineral formed by hydration-oxidation weathering of uraninite associated with post-mining processes.

results.name: Palladosilicide
results.description_short: The Si analogue of palladogermanide.

results.name: Arsmirandite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Co-described with lehmannite from which it is visually indistinguishable.

The two have similar, unique structural features:

- Fe3+ (or Ti4+, in lehmannite) in cubic coordination;
- packing of unusual, nanoscale (~1.5 nm acros...

results.name: Tvrdýite
results.description_short:
Isostructural with beraunite. Chemically similar to cacoxenite, childrenite, ferrivauxite, metavauxite, paravauxite, sigloite, and vauxite; also matulaite. 

The type material is significantly enriched in Zn.

Difference from beraunite: Al dominanc...

results.name: Agmantinite
results.description_short: Structurally related to wurtzite.

results.name: Lipuite
results.description_short: New structure type.

results.name: Addibischoffite
results.description_short:
The Al analogue of beckettite and warkite.

Chemically similar to brownmillerite, dmitryivanovite, grossite, hibonite, and krotite.

A new refractory phase formed in the solar nebula, most likely as a result of crystallization from an 16O-rich Ca, ...

results.name: Nolzeite
results.description_short:
A pyroxenoid related to steedeite (its anhydrous counterpart) and the members of the pectolite-sérandite series.

Crystal structure details: (1) chains of tetrahedra (dreier type) with 3 independent SiO4 groups in C-shaped clusters; (2) BO2(OH)2 tetr...

results.name: Morrisonite
results.description_short:
Related to vanarsite and packratite.

One (second?) of the most complex mineral species to date, after ewingite; compare, e.g., ilmajokite and batoniite.

results.name: Suseinargiuite
results.description_short: The Na-Bi analogue of wulfenite. Unique combination of elements. It is in a good correspondence to the synthetic phase, which has a scheelite-type structure.

results.name: Ferrostalderite
results.description_short:
The iron analogue of stalderite. Chemically similar to ferrovoronstovite.

Structure and crystallochemistry details (Biagioni et al., 2016): Cu present in the M1 and Zn in M2 site; the framework is built of (Cu,Fe)-centered tetrahedra and has channel...

results.name: Karpenkoite
results.description_short: The Co analogue of martyite. At the type locality karpenkoite occurs as a secondary mineral formed during the post-mining oxidation of corvusite and montroseite in a moist environment at ambient temperatures.

results.name: Polloneite
results.description_short:
New member of the sartorite homologous series (N=4). Its Ag content, although small, is important.

Chemically similar to, i.a., arsenquatrandorite, barikaite, jasrouxite, parasterryite, and montpelvouxite.

The structure is a 3-fold superstructure...

results.name: Bosiite
results.description_short: The Al (Z-site exchange) analogue of povondraite and Fe3+ (Y-site exchange) analogue of chromo-alumino-povondraite and vanadio-oxy-dravite. [6]Fe3+3 → [6]Al3 substitution describes its relation to oxy-dravite.

results.name: Crimsonite
results.description_short:
The P analogue of carminite. Chemically related to kintoreite and pattersonite.

In the structure, there are edge-sharing FeO6 octahedra, forming dimers. The dimers share corners to form chains along [010]. The phosphate groups connect the chains to ...

results.name: Gatewayite
results.description_short: Related to vanarsite and packratite. The other polyoxometalate from the same site is, e.g., kegginite.

results.name: Jeffbenite
results.description_short:
High-pressure polymorph of pyrope.
New structure type.
The petrological importance of jeffbenite is related to its very deep origin, which may allow its use as a pressure marker for detecting super-deep diamonds. Previous experimental work carried ou...

results.name: Fogoite-(Y)
results.description_short:
Chemically close to hainite. May also be compared to batievaite-(Y), which however is devoid of dominant Na.

The structure is, as of many Ti silicates, built of TS (Titanium Silicate) blocks, comprising HOH sheets (H for heteropolyhedral, O for octa...

results.name: Tavagnascoite
results.description_short:
The Bi analogue of klebelsbergite. Chemically related to cannonite, riomarinaite; balićžunićite and leguernite. The fifth natural bismuth sulfate devoid of additional cations. 

Associates with other, uncharacterized, secondary Bi minerals.

The st...

results.name: Arsenowagnerite
results.description_short: The arsenate analogue of wagnerite.

results.name: Möhnite
results.description_short: Ammonium analogue to aphthitalite. Found in a guano deposit.

results.name: Riotintoite
results.description_short:
New structure type.

Chemically related to aluminite, felsőbányaite, hydrobasaluminite, jurbanite, mangazeite, meta-aluminite, rostite, schlossmacherite, 'werthemanite', 'winebergite', and zaherite.

results.name: Calciomurmanite
results.description_short:
The Na-Ca ordered analogue of murmanite. Chemically related to, e.g., kolskyite.

One of many species based on sheet-structured HOH heteropolyhedral-octahedral blocks. It has three sheets of the following content:

- the O sheet: NaO6 and TiO6 octa...

results.name: Dravertite
results.description_short:
Chemically and structurally related to chalcocyanite.

Crystal structure contains chains of alternating edge-sharing octahedra, with centers occupied by Cu or Mg, the second metal forming much more regular ones. The chains are connected via isolated ...

results.name: Honzaite
results.description_short: Ni-dominant analogue of burgessite.

results.name: Cryptochalcite
results.description_short:
New structure type. The K (or K2-) analogue of cesiodymite.

Visually indistinguishable from cesiodymite.

results.name: Bubnovaite
results.description_short:
Structurally related to 'glaserite' (aphthitalite). Also structurally, and chemically, related to dobrovolskyite.

K, Na and Ca cations form a superstructure with ABACABACABAC twelve-layering; the sulfate tetrahedra are disordered.

Chemically quit...

results.name: Apexite
results.description_short: New structure type. Structurally related to hazenite (member of the struvite group).

results.name: Pauladamsite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Chemically somewhat similar to munakataite.

Crystal structure details: (1) four different CuO6 octahedra, edge-sharing to form 5-octahedra-wide bands along [100]; (2) SO4 tetrahedra; (3) SeO3 pyramids. The neighbouring bands are ...

results.name: Perettiite-(Y)
results.description_short:
New structure type. The element combination is unique; other Y- & Fe-bearing borosilicate minerals are represented by laptevite-(Ce) and proshchenkoite-(Y), but their composition is more complex.

The structure contains: (1) two eight-coordinated sit...

results.name: Norilskite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Chemically close to plumbopalladinite, 'plumbopolarite', zvyagintsevite, and some unnamed species like 'Unnamed (Pd2Pb)'.

The mineral crystallizes in the Ni13Ga3Ge6 structural type that is related to the nickeline structure.

results.name: Sulfhydrylbystrite
results.description_short:
Doubly unique in being the first known mineral with sulhydryl (SH) and the only one with pentasulphide anion at once. The second mineral with species-defining sulfhydryl (hydrosulfide) anion is sapozhnikovite. 

First member of the cancrinite group w...

results.name: Czochralskiite
results.description_short: Glaserite-type structure, related to that of buchwaldite and brianite.

results.name: Huizingite-(Al)
results.description_short:
New structure type. The first NH4-Al sulphate that is both basic and hydrated. Somewhat chemically comparable to ammonioalunite and tschermigite. Some analyses have Fe > Al, thus corresponding to 'unnamed (Fe analogue of huizingite-(Al))'.

The bipar...

results.name: Decagonite
results.description_short:
A natural quasicrystal phase, second to be discovered and approved after icosahedrite. 

A synthetic analogue is known. It is not possible to give three-dimensional unit-cell values for this mineral.

See also Bindi et al. (2022)paper on another - ...

results.name: Melcherite
results.description_short:
A hexaniobate related to peterandresenite.

Melcherite has structural layers parallel to the xy plane that stack along the c-axis with simultaneous 1/3 [1 -1 0] displacement so as to produce a R lattice. The melcherite structure is built by layers of...

results.name: Metauramphite
results.description_short: A doubtful mineral.

results.name: Grundmannite
results.description_short:
The Se analogue of emplectite.

The two independent selenium positions are in well accordance to two sulfur sites of the isotypic emplectite. Bismuth forms BiSe3 trigonal pyramids, while Cu is present as nearly regular CuSe4 tetrahedra.

results.name: Batievaite-(Y)
results.description_short: The element combination is unique. The Na-deficient Y analogue of hainite. You might also want to compare fogoite-(Y).

results.name: Saranchinaite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Chemically similar to petrovite.
Transforms into kröhnkite within one week when exposed to open air at 87% relative humidity and 25°C (Siidra et al., 2018).

results.name: Jörgkellerite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Layered phosphate-carbonate mineral.

The layers are built of disordered edge-sharing MnO6 octahedra. Each fourth Mn site in octahedral layer is vacant leading to an ordered system of hexagonal "holes" that contain the carbonate g...

results.name: Andychristyite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Chemically related to housleyite, khinite, paratimrosite, and timroseite. Structurally related to bairdite, eckhardite, paratimroseite, and timroseite.

Crystal structure details: stair-step-like hcp layers built of TeO6 and CuO6 ...

results.name: Alfredopetrovite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Unique combination of elements; the first aluminium selenite mineral.

Compare llantenesite and petermegawite.

Structural details/elements:
- quite regular AlO6 octahedra
- SeO3 triangular pyramids
- [Al(H2O)3]2(SeO3)3 clust...

results.name: Ciriottiite
results.description_short: The Cu analogue of sterryite. Ciriottiite can also be described as an expanded derivative of owyheeite. Related to meerschautite.

results.name: Penberthycroftite
results.description_short:
Closely related to bettertonite, which is a higher hydrate. Also chemically similar to liskeardite, bulachite, and hydroniumpharmacoalumite; and to mansfieldite.

The structure is heteropolyhedral layered one, with undulating layering || {010}. In th...

results.name: Garronite-Na
results.description_short: Forms a series with garronite-Ca

results.name: Strontioperloffite
results.description_short: The Sr analogue of perloffite.

results.name: Odigitriaite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Unique combination of elements; second Cs-Na-Ca mineral after senkevichite.

The structure is based on double-layer borosilicate sheet, with Cs and Na intercalation; double layers are connected via Ca and Na atoms.

results.name: Kayrobertsonite
results.description_short: The OH analogue of nordgauite. Structural topology similar to that of nordgauite, but with double amount of water molecules in the [001] channels.

results.name: Canosioite
results.description_short:
The Ba analogue of arsenbrackebuschite and the As (or arsenate) analogue of gamagarite. 
Chemically related to dussertite and bariopharmacosiderite. Enriched in Mn3+ and V, which is suggestible for series formation with tokyoite; canosioite stands for...

results.name: Mendeleevite-(Nd)
results.description_short: The Nd-analogue of mendeleevite-(Ce). Unique combination of elements; the first Cs-Nd mineral.

results.name: Żabińskiite
results.description_short:
The second Ta-bearing silicate mineral after holtite. Isostructural with triclinic modification of titanite, see triclinic titanite . Identical to titanite and other titanite group species in terms of bond topology. 

Titanites associated with żabińs...

results.name: Kummerite
results.description_short:
Chemically similar to rittmannite.

A difference from laueite: Al and Fe3+ are ordered into alternate octahedral sites within chains.

results.name: Gazeevite
results.description_short:
One of a few Ba-Ca silicate-sulfate minerals, especially similar to dargaite and somewhat to wenkite. Structurally related to nabimusaite group (e.g., zadovite).

The structure is of modular-layered type, derived from that of hatrurite. More specific...

results.name: Chongite
results.description_short:
The Mg analogue of sainfeldite. Chemically related to irhtemite and picropharmacolite; also similar to adelite, camgasite, talmessite, and wendwilsonite.

See also UM1997-09-AsO:CaHMgZn which is probably identical to chongite.

results.name: Gajardoite
results.description_short:
New structure type. The K analogue of gajardoite-(NH4). Unique combination of elements (at the upload time). Structurally related to torrecillasite. Compare russoite (also As2O3-containing species).

There are two types of layers in the structure: (1...

results.name: Wilancookite
results.description_short:
Related to pahasapaite.

Wilancookite, pahasapaite, weinebeneite, and limousinite are the only known phosphate minerals with a zeolite-type (or zeolite-like) topology.

results.name: Lucchesiite
results.description_short: Ca-O-analogue of schorl. The Fe analogue of magnesio-lucchesiite.

results.name: Navrotskyite
results.description_short: Unique combination of elements. Structurally related to meisserite and fermiite.

results.name: Hexacelsian
results.description_short:
High-temperature polymorph.
Known as a synthetic compound (disordered β-BaAl^2Si^2O^8).

results.name: Cyprine
results.description_short:
The name 'cyprine' was previously given to any blue variety of vesuvianite on the (not always correct) assumption that it contained abundant copper.
Some blue 'cyprine' specimens may in fact contain sufficient copper, but many specimens do not contain...

results.name: Ilirneyite
results.description_short: The Mn3+ analogue of zemannite. Also Zn-Mn(3+)-analogue of kinichilite and keystoneite.

results.name: Itelmenite
results.description_short:
Chemically somewhat similar but more simple than dravertite and saranchinaite.

The structure of itelmenite is based on a unique type of [A2+3(SO4)4]2- (A = Mg, Cu, Zn) heteropolyhedral framework with voids filled by Na+ cations.

results.name: Joegoldsteinite
results.description_short: The Mn analogue of daubréelite. Also Mn analogue of kalininite and cuprokalininite (all have the same space group).

results.name: Hermannjahnite
results.description_short:
The Zn analogue of dravertite. Chemically somewhat similar to christelite and ktenasite, that are hydrated phases.

The structure of hermannjahnite is isotypic to that of dravertite, CuMg(SO4)2, and represents a monoclinically distorted chalcocyanite...

results.name: Grootfonteinite
results.description_short: Structurally related to hydrocerussite and plumbonacrite. Chemically related to shannonite and UM1995-03-CO:Pb.

results.name: Manganiceladonite
results.description_short:
The Mn3+ analogue of celadonite. End-member celadonite subgroup micas are dioctahedral. 
Second K-Mg-Mn mineral after lipuite. Contains trace Mn4+ and some Li.

results.name: Kainotropite
results.description_short:
New structure type.
Other minerals containing copper and divanadate group: blossite, engelhauptite, volborthite, ziesite.

results.name: Maneckiite
results.description_short: The M(3)Mn analogue of wicksite. The element combination (in terms of element dominance) is only shared with 'Mg-Fillowite'.

results.name: Wiklundite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Chemically somewhat similar to hereroite. The mineral is associated, i.a., with a disordered wiklundite-like species.

The structure has 5 polyhedral layers, comprising:
- Mn2+-bearing octahedra, edge-sharing to form trimers and ...

results.name: Lislkirchnerite
results.description_short: New structure type. First natural lead-bearing nitrate. Second Al-bearing nitrate after sveite.

results.name: Shumwayite
results.description_short:
New structure type.

One of the most simple uranyl sulfate minerals to date. Chemically similar (although basic) minerals are jáchymovite, uranopilite, metauranopilite.

Crystal structure details: (1) UO7 pentagonal bipyramids (2) SO4 tetrahedra; (...

results.name: Fluorcarmoite-(BaNa)
results.description_short: Compare penriceite.

results.name: Wampenite
results.description_short:
An organic mineral
New structure type. Other carbon-hydrogen minerals include: dinite, evenkite, fichtelite, hartite, idrialite, kratochvílite, 'phylloretine', ravatite, simonellite, "voltzite" (carbon-hydrogen sulfur), and not IMA-accepted adamantane...

results.name: Charleshatchettite
results.description_short:
Related to franconite and hochelagaite. Chemically similar to hochelagaite, but is distinguished from hochelagaite by its powder X‑ray diffraction patterns.
Charleshatchettite is a late-stage mineral, interpreted to have developed through the interact...

results.name: Plavnoite
results.description_short: Related to zippeite.

results.name: Honeaite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Chemistry unique among minerals.
The synthetic phases Au3TlTe2 (dimorph) and Au18Tl4Te11 have completely different structures.

According to Bondarenko et al. (2005), Au3TlTe2 (at that time unnamed) has also been reported from th...

results.name: Marklite
results.description_short:
New structure type.

Visually similar to devilline and serpierite.

Chemically similar to georgeite; also to claraite (Zn-bearing) and 'cuproartinite' (Mg-bearing); and to azurite and malachite (basic but without water molecules).

results.name: Ferraioloite
results.description_short:
First described from sample found at the eastern dump of the Foote Lithium Company mine, Cleveland Co., North Carolina, USA. 

Closely related to falsterite. Chemically somewhat resembles jasonsmithite.

The structure is layered with heteropolyhedr...

results.name: Hansesmarkite
results.description_short:
New structure type. 
Hansesmarkite is extremely prone to dehydration. 

The third naturally occurring hexaniobate. Chemically similar to the hexaniobate peterandresenite; further similarity to heteropolyniobates menezesite and aspedamite. As in pete...

results.name: Feodosiyite
results.description_short:
New structure type.

Chemially similar to haydeeite, paratacamite-(Mg) and tondiite.

results.name: Ilyukhinite
results.description_short: The second hydronium-dominant member after aqualite, also characterized in predominance of Mn over Fe (the M2 position, the Mn located in the centre of tetragonal pyramid). Chemically somewhat similar to manganoeudialyte and låvenite.

results.name: Dargaite
results.description_short:
The F-deficient Ba analogue of nabimusaite. Chemically similar to gazeevite and wenkite. 

Spatially related (coexisting) with nabimusaite and gazeevite.

Holotype specimen assemblage: larnite, fluorellestadite–fluorapatite, brownmillerite, fluorma...

results.name: Mesaite
results.description_short:
Structurally related to fianelite. Chemically similar to palenzonaite. Other divanadate minerals include engelhauptite, karpenkoite, martyite, and volborthite.

The structure is based on zigzag chains comprising edge-sharing MnO6 octahedra. Octahedra...

results.name: Heptasartorite
results.description_short:
Sartorite homologous series. 
Physical and optical properties similar to  enneasartorite and hendekasartorite. Careful quantitative chhemical analysis and/or single-crystal X-ray diffraction is needed to distinguish them.

results.name: Hendekasartorite
results.description_short:
Sartorite homologous series.
Physical and optical properties similar to enneasartorite and heptasartorite. Careful quantitative chemical analysis and/or single-crystal X-ray diffraction are needed to distinguish them.

results.name: Enneasartorite
results.description_short:
Sartorite homologous series.
Physical and optical properties similar to heptasartorite and hendekasartorite. Careful quantitative chemical analysis and/or single-crystal X-ray diffraction is needed to distinguish them.

NOTE: Enneasartorite correspo...

results.name: Castellaroite
results.description_short:
Probably a polymorph of sterlinghillite. Structurally related to metaswitzerite.
A higher hydrate (octahydrate) is manganohörnesite.

results.name: Fluorwavellite
results.description_short: The F analogue of wavellite. A low-temperature secondary mineral. Visually indistinguishable from wavellite, since it is essentially identical to wavellite in appearance and physical properties. Same structure as wavellite, differing only in having one...

results.name: Kyawthuite
results.description_short:
Well-known as a synthetic compound. The only approved Bi-Sb oxide mineral. May be a chemical analogue of clinobisvanite, BiVO4, but the space groups are slightly different. Not analogous to bismutocolumbite or bismutotantalite.

Crystal structure det...

results.name: Juansilvaite
results.description_short:
New structure type. The only Na-Al-As-S mineral (unique combination).

The associated minerals include mahnertite-like phase.

The structure is based on layers built of alternating corner-connected AlO6 octahedra and acid-arsenate tetrahedra. There...

results.name: Steinmetzite
results.description_short: Structurally and chemically related to phosphophyllite. Also chemically similar to wilhelmgümbelite, zincoberaunite, 'UKI-2006-(PO:FeHZn)' (hydrated phases), plimerite and zinclipscombite (basic anhydrous salts).

results.name: Vasilseverginite
results.description_short:
New structure type.

It is the first copper mineral of the Tolbachik volcano with both arsenate and sulphate anions. The only fumarolic arsenate mineral with arsenate and sulfate tetrahedra representing separate structural positions.

Chemically so...

results.name: Kannanite
results.description_short: The Ca analogue of ardennite-(V). Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Millsite
results.description_short:
A polymorph of teineite.

At the type locality millsite occurs together with teineite, which here has generally a more darker royal blue color. This feature has been used by collectors to distinguish between the two phases. But using the color is not...

results.name: Vránaite
results.description_short:
Related to boralsilite and boromullite. 

Product of breakdown of spodumene.

Crystal structure details: chains of AlO6 octahedra, || [010], cross linked by disilicate groups; triangular BO3 groups; chains with AlO4 and two AlO5 polyhedra; partiall...

results.name: Klaprothite
results.description_short:
Related to ottohahnite. 

Also chemically related to belakovskiite, fermiite, meisserite, oppenheimerite, plášilite, and natrozippeite.

Found together with péligotite and ottohahnite; the three minerals are very similar in terms of physical and ch...

results.name: Péligotite
results.description_short:
Related to ottohahnite. 

Also chemically similar to fermiite and oppenheimerite; further, lesser similarity with sulfate-hydrosulfates belakovskiite and meisserite, and basic sulfates plášilite and natrozippeite.

Found together with klaprothite a...

results.name: Wilhelmgümbelite
results.description_short:
Related to schoonerite - an oxidized form of schoonerite with Mn2+ largely replaced by Fe3+. Chemistry similar to phosphophyllite, plimerite, steinmetzite, zinclipscombite, and zincoberaunite (these minerals have homovalent iron).
Also related to schm...

results.name: Abellaite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue. Chemically similar to sanrománite.

For more information about this mineral, see https://www.mindat.org/photo-1307046.html

results.name: Mengxianminite
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements. Mengxianminite is the first borate mineral with both Sn and Be, likely crystallized under F-rich conditions at late stages of the Xianghualing skarn. Other Sn-B minerals are nordenskiöldine, tusionite...

results.name: Écrinsite
results.description_short:
Sartorite homologous series, with N = 3.5, as in baumhauerite, argentobaumhauerite, boscardinite, and bernarlottiite); closely related to the latter two.

Combination of elements is unique. Somewhat similar to UM1999-20-S:AgAsPbSbTl.

results.name: Tinnunculite
results.description_short:
Not to be confused with Tinnunculite (of Chesnokov & Shcherbakova).

A naturally occurring dihydrate of uricite (uric acid) to which it is visually very similar.

Well-known though rare component of urinary and other stones (a biomineral).

Chemi...

results.name: Goryainovite
results.description_short:
Synthetic analogue known. A new halophosphate, the chlorine analogue of "spodiosite" (Ca2(PO4)F).
Chemically related to chlorapatite.

results.name: Zincobriartite
results.description_short:
Zn analogue of briartite. 

Unique combination of elements - the only approved Cu-Zn-Ge mineral.

The phase of the above composition, apparently from Kipushi mine, was codified as UM1965-10-S:CuFeGeZn.

results.name: Ferricoronadite
results.description_short:
Fe3+ analogue of coronadite. 
Chemically related to lindqvistite, plumboferrite, zenzénite, magnetoplumbite.

The structure is based on double chains comprising (Mn,Fe,Ti)-centered octahedra that share edges; the chains have common vertices, thus fo...

results.name: Magnesiovoltaite
results.description_short: The Mg analogue of voltaite. Also the K analogue of ammoniomagnesiovoltaite. Chemically related to pertlikite.

results.name: Alwilkinsite-(Y)
results.description_short:
New structure type. 

Chemically related to sejkoraite-(Y), which is the second yttrium-uranyl sulfate mineral currently known. Other Y-UO2 minerals: bijvoetite-(Y), kamotoite-(Y) (carbonates). These three minerals and alwilkinsite-(Y) constitute the...

results.name: Ottohahnite
results.description_short:
Related to klaprothite and péligotite. 

Also chemically related to fermiite and oppenheimerite. 

Further relation to sulfate-hydrosulfates belakovskiite and meisserite, and to basic salts plášilite and natrozippeite.

Found together with péligo...

results.name: Hansblockite
results.description_short: The monoclinic structure is stabilized by Hg and Pb.

results.name: Petříčekite
results.description_short:
The Cu analogue of ferroselite and kullerudite. Chemically related minerals: athabascaite, bellidoite, berzelianite, klockmannite, umangite.

Associated, i.a., with some unknown selenides.

The structure is based on edge-sharing chains of CuSe6 oct...

results.name: Kalgoorlieite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue (which has thermoelectric applications). Compare orpiment and laphamite: although chemical analogues and monoclinic, these are not isostructural with kalgoorlieite.

Kalgoorlieite is the fourth oxygen-free As-Te mineral after...

results.name: Hydroxylgugiaite
results.description_short:
An H-bearing member of the melilite group. Closely related to gugiaite.
It occurs as a hydrothermal replacement of Be silicate minerals.

results.name: Hakite-(Zn)
results.description_short: One of four types of hakite subgroup minerals from Příbram, Czech Republic, which also include Hakite-(Hg), Hakite-(Fe) and Hakite-(Cd). Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Hakite-(Cd)
results.description_short: The rarest of four hakite subgroup minerals from Příbram, Czech Republic, which also include Hakite-(Hg), Hakite-(Fe) and Hakite-(Zn). Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Hydroxylhedyphane
results.description_short:
An arsenate apatite supergroup mineral belonging to the hedyphane group.  It was approved as a new minerals species by IMA in 2018 (IMA2018-52), and described as a new species by Biagioni et al. (2019). 

A fibrous material found at Långban, Sweden a...

results.name: Middlebackite
results.description_short: Compare moolooite and fiemmeite; antipinite and wheatleyite.

results.name: Verbierite
results.description_short: The Cr analogue of byrudite. Unique combination of elements. Second Be-Cr mineral after mariinskite.

results.name: Magnesiovesuvianite
results.description_short: The Mg analogue of vesuvianite and cyprine (of Panikorovskii et al., 2017); also the Mg-(OH) analogue of manganvesuvianite.

results.name: Russoite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue. Unique combination of elements. Chemically somewhat similar to lucabindiite, gajardoite (also hexagonal), and torrecillasite (all having arsenic oxide groups in the structure).

Structure details:
* electrically neutral As2...

results.name: Dioskouriite
results.description_short:
Chemically related to centennialite; compare Unnamed (Ca-Cu Chloride).

Two polytypes, intergrown with each other, are known.

results.name: Philoxenite
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Marcobaldiite
results.description_short: A N = 3.5 homologue of the jordanite homologous series, characterized by the 1:1 alternation of two kinds of layers of distorted octahedra, three- and four-octahedra thick, i.e. of the kirkiite and jordanite types, respectively.  Layers are connected b...

results.name: Hodgesmithite
results.description_short: Closely related to schulenbergite (also trigonal), having one of seven Cu-dominated sites replaced with single Zn-dominated one. Also chemically related to ktenasite and christelite. Compare 'UM1992-30-SO:CCuHZn', the Zn analogue of schulenbergite, 'Un...

results.name: Borisenkoite
results.description_short: The V analogue of lammerite-β. Most likely polymorphous with mcbirneyite and pseudolyonsite (to be confirmed).

results.name: Kegginite
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements. Also unique in being the first mineral with vanadyl-containing polyoxometalate anion. First natural Pb arsenovanadate, and the first mineral combining Pb and VO group. One of a few polyoxometalte from...

results.name: Spryite
results.description_short:
The As analogue of argyrodite and canfieldite. Interesting (possibly unique) in being a sulphosalt with two valencies of As.

Reported as the "first As3+-bearing natural argyrodite".

results.name: Zincoberaunite
results.description_short: The Zn analogue of beraunite. Chemically similar especially to steinmetzite and wilhelmgümbelite.

results.name: Eleomelanite
results.description_short:
Unique combination of elements. Related to wulffite and parawulffite (e.g., in stoichiometry). Compare palmierite.

Novel structure type but has common structural features with klyuchevskite, alumoklyuchevskite, wulffite, parawulffite, and piypite.

results.name: Paragersdorffite
results.description_short: A disordered pyrite-type structural polymorph of gersdorffite (also cubic) and orthogersdorffite (orthorhombic-pseudocubic).

results.name: Hingganite-(Nd)
results.description_short:
The Nd analogue of hingganite-(Y). As zones in Pakistani hingganite-(Y). Second Nd-Be mineral after gadolinite-(Nd).


Hingganites from Bacúch deposit, Slovakia, are locally enriched in Nd, with Nd-dominant areas having 17.8-18.7 wt.% Nd, accounting...

results.name: Wrightite
results.description_short: New structure type. Chemically close minerals are filatovite, pharmacoalumite, and to some extent also dmisokolovite. Third arsenate-oxide of K and Al after nishanbaevite and dmisokolovite. Also somewhat related to alumoedtollite and urusovite.

results.name: Cabvinite
results.description_short: New structure type. The first purely thorium-halogenide, thorium-fluoride, and actinide halogenide mineral to date.

results.name: Ewingite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Chemically resembles rabbittite, swartzite, and albrechtschraufite.

The most structurally complex mineral to date (however, compare ilmajokite-(Ce); and batoniite).

results.name: Matyhite
results.description_short: Reported as a member of merrillite group. The Ca analogue of ferromerrillite and Mg analogue of keplerite. First anhydrous purely Ca-Fe phosphate mineral.

results.name: Huenite
results.description_short:
Chemically close to lindgrenite, markascherite, and szenicsite. Structure of the mineral is determined.

Reported as copper-molybdenum oxy-hydroxide mineral. Associates include an unknown pale purple phase.

results.name: Braunerite
results.description_short: New structure type. Chemically similar to línekite.

results.name: Wayneburnhamite
results.description_short:
The Ca (or rather Ca6-) analogue of ganomalite. Apatite polysome.

The only purely Pb-Ca hydrogen- and halogen-devoid silicate mineral. Chemically slightly similar to nasonite. Representative of a very small group of minerals with the P-6 space group...

results.name: Cardite
results.description_short:
New structure type (the structure is determined). The first zinc arsenate-hydroxyarsenate mineral. Chemically similar to koritnigite (another Zn hydroxyarsenate).

Crystal structure is based on sheets edge-sharing octahedra; details:
- there is one ...

results.name: Selivanovaite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Chemically similar minerals include ivanyukite-Na, ivanyukite-Na-C, ivanyukite-Na-T, penkvilksite, and to some extent also tiettaite.

Found in drill cores from 100-130 m below the ground, coming from the Lovozero Eudialyte Comple...

results.name: Příbramite
results.description_short:
The Se analogue of chalcostibite. 

Chemically related to permingeatite and bytízite.

The associates also include a new Hg-Cu-Sb selenide and a new Sb-Cu selenide.

There is a single Cu and single Sb site in the structure, which also contains tw...

results.name: Leószilárdite
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Whiteite-(CaMgMg)
results.description_short:
Chemically similar to angastonite, montgomeryite, and overite.
A low temperature, secondary mineral formed as a result of hydrothermal alteration.

results.name: Cesiodymite
results.description_short: The Cs (or CsK-) analogue of cryptochalcite. The mineral is doubly-unique being the first Cs sulphate mineral and also the first one to combine Cs and Cu as species-defining elements. It is also the sixth Cs mineral of the oxysalts group (discluding si...

results.name: Gauthierite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Unique combination of elements.

Structurally related to vandendriesscheite.

results.name: Luogufengite
results.description_short:
An Al-bearing ε-Fe2O3, a Fe2O3 polymorph. The structure is determined.

An oxidation product of Fe-bearing basaltic glass at high temperature. Luogufengite is an important mineral that records paleomagnetism of volcanic rocks because of its large mag...

results.name: Hydroxyferroroméite
results.description_short:
The Fe2+-dominant member of the roméite group of the pyrochlore supergroup.
The Fe([]) analogue of hydroxycalcioroméite. Chemically comparable to 'flajolotite', schafarzikite, and tripuhyite.

results.name: Edtollite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Unique combination of elements. Compare melanarsite, pansnerite and achyrophanite.

The Fe(III) analogue of alumoedtollite.

results.name: Wangdaodeite
results.description_short: A high-pressure high-temperature polymorph. The P–T conditions for the formation of wangdaodeite are estimated to be 20–24 GPa and >1200°C.

results.name: Butianite
results.description_short: The Sn analogue of nuwaite. Compare the chemically similar 'UM1981-20-S:NiSbSnTe'. Beside the latter, there is currently no other known natural Ni-Sn sulphide.

results.name: Stolperite
results.description_short:
Found as inclusions in khatyrkite, or accompanying icosahedrite and/or hollisterite (Al3Fe) and khatyrkite; it is being surrounded by forsterite, spinel, and glass. Forms crystals, from 0.5 to 3 μm in size.

Chemically similar to khatyrkite. Compare ...

results.name: Ferrisanidine
results.description_short: The Fe3+ analogue of sanidine.

results.name: Chinleite-(Y)
results.description_short:
The Y analogue of chinleite-(Nd).

Structurally related to bassanite; contains irregular NaO8 polyhedra and distorted YO9 tri-capped prisms.

Well known as a synthetic compound. The most simple natural Y-rich sulphate mineral (compare, e.g., levins...

results.name: Javorieite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue. The Fe analogue of chlorocalcite. Chemically identical to 'Unnamed (K-Fe Chloride)'. Compare erythrosiderite.

Extremely hygroscopic and readily oxidised if exposed to the air. 

Note: isostructural with the synthetic anal...

results.name: Gadolinite-(Nd)
results.description_short:
The second mineral combining Nd and Be after hingganite-(Nd).

Approved in 2016; Nd-dominant members had been reported previously (Kolitsch et al., 2008; Pršek et al., 2010).

results.name: Alumovesuvianite
results.description_short: A member of the vesuvianite group with Al3+ as a dominant cation in the Y1 site.

results.name: Arsenatrotitanite
results.description_short: Tilasite-durangite group. The chemistry is not unique - see braithwaiteite.

results.name: Ferrorhodonite
results.description_short: The Fe-substituted equivalent of rhodonite.

results.name: Ozerovaite
results.description_short: Unique combination of elements. Known synthetic analogue.

results.name: Marinaite
results.description_short: The Cu analogue of ludwigite. Unique combination of elements: the only currently known natural borate of both Cu and Fe.

results.name: Nataliyamalikite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue. Chemically the iodine analogue of lafossaite (which has, however, a different crystal structure).

Probably formed at temperatures below 175 oC. Some of the crystals show cubic symmetry (of a supposed polymorph of lafossaite).

results.name: Zincostrunzite
results.description_short: Chemically related to steinmetzite, zincoberaunite, and UM2006-27-PO:FeHZn, the latter being a lower hydrate equivalent of the species. Also chemically similar to plimerite, wilhelmgümbelite, zinclipscombite, and phosphophyllite.

results.name: Qatranaite
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue. The only currently known natural Ca-Zn hydroxide, or possibly a Ca hexahydroxozincate.

results.name: Rippite
results.description_short: New structure type

results.name: Bytízite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue.
Chemically related to permingeatite and příbramite. The SbSe analogue of wittichenite. Chemically the Se analogue of skinnerite, but this is not a true analogy due to the difference in crystal system.

The crystal structure...

results.name: Argentoliveingite
results.description_short:
A silver-bearing sulphosalt belongong to the sartorite group (Sartorite homologous series).
Closely related to liveingite and "rathite-IV".

The mineral is noticeable for its very large unit-cell parameter c.

results.name: Currierite
results.description_short:
A natural pure hydroxyarsenate, which is relatively rare. 

Chemically resembles anatolyite. Structurally related to kaatialaite.

results.name: Deltalumite
results.description_short:
Al-analogue of maghemite.

Paglia (2004) reports the following calcination pathway: gibbsite → böhmite → γ-Al2O3 (Unnamed (gamma-alumina)) → δ-Al2O3 (synthetic equivalent of deltalumite) → θ-Al2O3 (synthetic equivalent of UM1990-23-O:Al) → α-Al2O3 (c...

results.name: Hydropascoite
results.description_short: First found in the main tunnel level of the Packrat mine. Related to pascoite. Also similar to kokinosite and nashite in terms of being both a decavanadate and a tetracosahydrate.

results.name: Parisite-(La)
results.description_short: The La analogue of parisite-(Ce). Chemically similar to 'synchysite-(La)'.

results.name: Incomsartorite
results.description_short: Sartorite homologous series. Interestingly the structure is incommensurate, but it is approximant monoclinic.

results.name: Richardsollyite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Chemically similar to edenharterite, enneasartorite, hendekasartorite, hutchinsonite, and incomsartorite.

The Pb analogue of christite.

The structure has [Pb(AsS3)] layers located as per the (100) planes; the layers sandwich T...

results.name: Kryachkoite
results.description_short: Chemically similar to hollisterite and somewhat to icosahedrite. Known synthetic analogue.

results.name: Kravtsovite
results.description_short: A platinum-group mineral (PGM).

results.name: Merelaniite
results.description_short:
Cylindrite homologous series.

An arsenic-rich variety is also known. Merelaniite consists of alternating centered pseudo-tetragonal (Q) and pseudo-hexagonal (H) layers with respective PbS and MoS2 structure types.

Awarded 'Mineral of the Year' by...

results.name: Lombardoite
results.description_short:
The As (or arsenate) analogue of tokyoite. The Ba analogue of aldomarinoite. Two polytypes are known, one monoclinic (P21/m), one triclinic (P-1).

Compare 'Unnamed (Possible Ordered As-analogue of Tokyoite)'.

results.name: Calamaite
results.description_short: New structure type. Third Ti-dominant sulfate mineral after alcaparrosaite and innelite; second purely sulfate Ti-rich mineral.

results.name: Rowleyite
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements (compare another but still somewhat similar species from the same mine - davidbrownite-(NH4) - though); another ammonium-rich vanadate (or V-bearing) mineral after schindlerite, wernerbaurite, and rako...

results.name: Fleisstalite
results.description_short: The Fe2+ equivalent of gravegliaite.

results.name: Siidraite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Siidraite has a unique composition and structure (the only currently known Pb-Cu-I mineral). It is the third naturally occurring halocuprate(I) after marshite and nantokite.
The second lead iodide mineral after mutnovskite, and fou...

results.name: Anatolyite
results.description_short:
Chemically similar to currierite.

Isotypic with several synthetic compounds.

results.name: Zincobradaczekite
results.description_short: The Zn (or rather Zn2Cu2) analogue of bradaczekite. Unique combination of elements, although somewhat similar to johillerite.

results.name: Arsenmarcobaldiite
results.description_short: Belongs to the jordanite homologous series. Probably the As2Sb2 analogue of marcobaldiite.

results.name: Argentodufrénoysite
results.description_short: Member of the sartorite homologous series. Compare dufrénoysite.

results.name: Belousovite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Unique combination of elements. Possibly the Zn analogue of 'anhydrokainite'.

Compare 'Unnamed (Potassium Zinc Sulfate Chloride)'.

results.name: Khorixasite
results.description_short:
The Bi analogue of mottramite (compare also the discredited, Ca- and Bi-bearing mottramite variety "duhamelite"). 
Monoclinic-pseudoorthorhombic, closely related to the orthorhombic Adelite-Descloizite Group.

Chemically similar to namibite.

results.name: Omariniite
results.description_short: The Ge analogue of stannoidite. Chemically somewhat similar to zincobriartite, renierite, and briartite.  X-ray single-crystal studies (R1 = 0.023) revealed the structure to be a sphalerite derivative identical to that of stannoidite (Bindi et al. 2017).

results.name: Chirvinskyite
results.description_short: New structure type. Chemically somewhat similar to nafertisite, narsarsukite, and selivanovite. wöhlerite–related zirconotitano–sorosilicate.

results.name: Quijarroite
results.description_short: Chemically similar to petrovicite and 'Unnamed (Cu-Pb-Hg-Bi Selenide)'. It is chemically close to a species termed “Bi-rich petrovicite”  from the Schlema-Alberoda U-Se-polymetallic deposit (Erzgebirge, Germany); also somewhat similar to hansblockite.

results.name: Badalovite
results.description_short: Chemically resembles yazganite and yurmarinite.

results.name: Molinelloite
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue. The first vanadate mineral containing both copper and vanadyl group.

results.name: Hydroxykenoelsmoreite
results.description_short:
Compare hydrokenoelsmoreite. 

Ordering Fe3+ in one of the two W sites leads to lowering the symmetry (crystal system) from the typical isometric one of the trigonal one.

results.name: Magnesiocanutite
results.description_short: The MnMg2 analogue of canutite. The Na-Mn-Mg combination is also found in johninnesite, but the latter is an arsenate silicate mineral.

results.name: Tamboite
results.description_short: Closely related to metatamboite, which is a monohydrate equivalent of tamboite; chemically somewhat similar to poughite. The hydroxytellurate group in tamboite and metatamboite seems to be unique among minerals. Visually indistinguishable from metatamb...

results.name: Metatamboite
results.description_short:
Closely related to tamboite, which is a trihydrate equivalent of metatamboite; chemically somewhat similar to poughite. The hydroxytellurate group in tamboite and metatamboite seems to be unique among minerals.

The structure is determined.

results.name: Roymillerite
results.description_short:
Chemically quite similar to britvinite; structurally related to britvinite and molybdophyllite. The combination of anion types in roymillerite is unique.

Crystal structure details:
- pyrophyllite-type TOT-modules of the Mg9(OH)8[(Si,Al)10O28] compo...

results.name: Murakamiite
results.description_short: Muakamiite is a H-bearing pyroxenoid with three-periodicity of SiO4 tetrahedra and the Li-analogue of pectolite and Ca analogue of tanohataite.

results.name: Zhanghuifenite
results.description_short: Chemically similar to qingheiite.

results.name: Rietveldite
results.description_short:
The Fe analogue of zincorietveldite. Structurally related to svornostite. Chemically related to deliensite and leydetite (the latter being a higher hydrate). 

Known as a synthetic compound.

Occurs in association with other post-mining supergene u...

results.name: Marathonite
results.description_short:
The first germanide mineral to be discovered and approved (compare palladogermanide). Unique combination of elements (among approved species). New structure type.

Stable in the 550–970 °C range. Probably a physical and/or chemical alteration phase....

results.name: Epifanovite
results.description_short: The third known mineral to contain phosphate and arsenate (actually dihydroxoarsenate(V)) at separate structural positions (i.e., not substituting for each other) after machatschkiite and walentaite. Considering this separation, the chemical combinatio...

results.name: Leesite
results.description_short:
The second purely K-U oxide/hydroxide mineral after compreignacite.

A synthetic Na analogue is known.

results.name: Oxy-foitite
results.description_short: The FeAl2-O-analogue of foitite. Oxy-foitite belongs to the X-site vacant group of the tourmaline supergroup minerals, and shows chemical relationships with foitite through the substitution Y Al3+ + WO2 → YFe2+ + W(OH)1–.

results.name: Machiite
results.description_short:
The Al analogue of schreyerite. The first purely Al-Ti oxide mineral. The more detailed formula is (Al,Sc)2(Ti,Zr)3O9.

Chemically, but not structurally, the Al analogue of pseudorutile.

Machiite is depleted in the 16O isotope as compared to close...

results.name: Davidsmithite
results.description_short:
Ca-analogue of nepheline, to which it is related by the heterovalent substitution of 2K+ by [Ca2+☐]. Davidsmithite completes the compositional space of the nepheline-structure group by providing a new root-composition, (Ca☐)2Na6Al8Si8O32. 

Refered t...

results.name: Alpeite
results.description_short:
The Ca(Mn3+2Al2)-Mn3+ analogue of ardennite-(V).
At the type locality it crystallized from V- and Mn-rich hydrothermal fluids in an oxidizing environment.
In the structure of alpeite, Mn3+ is the dominant cation in the M1 site and is the dominant tri...

results.name: Magnesiobeltrandoite-2N3S
results.description_short: The root-name beltrandoite honours Marco Beltrando (Ivrea, 10 december 1978 - Frassinetto, 8 december 2015), geologist and petrologist at the Department of Earth Sciences of the University of Torino, for his sound contributions to the evolution of the ...

results.name: Fluorarrojadite-(BaNa)
results.description_short: Chemically resembles fluorarrojadite-(BaFe).

results.name: Vorontsovite
results.description_short: The Tl analogue of galkhaite and Hg analogue of ferrovorontsovite. Chemically related to routhierite.

results.name: Jaszczakite
results.description_short: The S-Bi analogue of buckhornite. Chemically related to jonassonite.

results.name: Magnesiohatertite
results.description_short: The Mg analogue of hatertite. Chemically related to anatolyite, paraberzeliite, berzeliite, calciojohillerite; also somewhat similar to currierite.

results.name: Burroite
results.description_short: Chemically related to wernerbaurite; the two species are the only known natural ammonium calcium vanadates.

results.name: Redcanyonite
results.description_short: Structurally related to zippeite. Unique combination of minerals; the first mineral to combine N, Mn, and U.

results.name: Hemleyite
results.description_short: High-pressure phase, discovered in an unmelted portion of the heavily shocked L6 Suizhou chondrite. Fe(II)-analogue of akimotoite. Ilmenite-type structure.

results.name: Rozhdestvenskayaite-(Zn)
results.description_short:
Chemically related to argentotetrahedrite-(Fe) and "freibergite" (which are both Fe-dominant on the Fe/Zn site).

Sb-analogue of zvěstovite-(Zn).

Probably the Zn analogue of UM1992-21-S:AgFeSb.

Renamed from rozhdestsvenskayaite due to the accep...

results.name: Kampelite
results.description_short: A Ba-Sc phosphate, an unique combination of elements.

results.name: Palladogermanide
results.description_short:
Related to marathonite. The Ge analogue of palladosilicide.

Stable under 200 °C. Probably a physical and/or chemical alteration phase.

Formed at 500–600 °C, under low fS2 and fO2, form Ge-dominant minerals.

results.name: Rudabányaite
results.description_short: Unique combination of elements. The first natural silver arsenate. Compare theuerdankite.

results.name: Perchiazziite
results.description_short:
The first (fully) cobaltoan member of the group. The Co analogue of either malachite or rosasite.

Compare sphaerocobaltite and škáchaite.

results.name: Markeyite
results.description_short:
New structure type.

Uranyl tricarbonate clusters (UTC) that are linked by Ca–O polyhedra forming thick corrugated heteropolyhedral layers. Included within the layers is an additional disordered CO3 group linking the Ca–O polyhedra. The layers are li...

results.name: Delhuyarite-(Ce)
results.description_short:
One single known sample.
Delhuyarite-(Ce)has the same structural topology as chevkinite subgroup minerals, e.g. chevkinite-(Ce). It is the only mineral of the group with a significant content of W6+ = 0.89 apfu.In delhuyarite-(Ce), Mg is dominant at t...

results.name: Riesite
results.description_short: The sixth polymorph of TiO2.

results.name: Stracherite
results.description_short: The first carbonate-bearing member of the group. Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Shinkolobweite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Another mineral with confirmed U5+ after richetite, wyartite, and nollmotzite.

Crystal structure details:

* uranyl oxide-hydroxide sheets with β-U3O8 topology;
* they are commensurately modulated with (3 + 1)  ordering due to...

results.name: Heyerdahlite
results.description_short:
Structure determined.

Compare, e.g., intersilite, janhaugite, and normandite.

results.name: Hyršlite
results.description_short: Compositionally hyršlite lies between guettardite and twinnite on the one hand, and hendekasartorite on the other hand.

results.name: Tiberiobardiite
results.description_short:
The Si analogue of chalcophyllite.

Related to barrotite.

results.name: Cesiokenopyrochlore
results.description_short:
Unique combination of elements: the only known mineral with both Cs and Nb as essential elements.

First natural "niobate" to adopt the inverse pyrochlore structure.

results.name: Topsøeite
results.description_short: The Fe3+ analogue of Rosenbergite. The first iron fluoride mineral.

results.name: Arsenmedaite
results.description_short: The As analogue of medaite.

results.name: Ariegilatite
results.description_short:
A member of the nabimusaite group exhibiting a modular intercalated antiperovskite structure derived from hatrurite. 
The P analogue of dargaite. Chemically similar to zadovite. 
Ariegilatite at the TL, is overgrown and partially replaced by stracher...

results.name: Staročeskéite
results.description_short:
A member of the lillianite homologous series with N = 4.
