There are 4 types of layers in the structure: 
- a planar, neutral As2O3 (arsenite) one,
- an (NH4+,K+) layer standing for a link for the adjacent arsenite sheets,
- a Cl– one, located on...

results.name: Badakhshanite-(Y)
results.description_short:
Related to perettiite-(Y) of which it is the AlBe-analogue.

Crystal structure details:
- tetrahedra form layers || (010) comprising of four different tetrahedrally coordinated sites: Si, B(1), B(2), and T;
- the above elements constitute 4-, 5-, a...

results.name: Ferriakasakaite-(Ce)
results.description_short:
A monoclinic (P21/m) epidote-supergroup mineral. 
Ce-analogue of ferriakasakaite-(La).

It is virtually impossible to distinguish between ferriakasakaite-(Ce) and manganiakasakaite-(La) by physical properties.

Compare Unnamed (Fe3+-analogue of pi...

results.name: Ekebergite
results.description_short: New structure type. Note, not to be confused with the varietal name for scapolite, "ekebergite (of Berzelius)".

results.name: Espadaite
results.description_short: New structure type

results.name: Natroaphthitalite
results.description_short: Isostructural with aphthitalite and möhnite.

results.name: Lehmannite
results.description_short:
Closely related to arsmirandite with which it was co-described.

The two have similar, unique structural features:

- Ti4+ (or Fe3+, in arsmirandite) in cubic coordination;
- packing of unusual, nanoscale (~1.5 nm across) clusters, of the {[MCu12O...

results.name: Lumsdenite
results.description_short: Belongs to the vanarsite family of minerals.

results.name: Armellinoite-(Ce)
results.description_short: Tiny pale yellow to brown-yellow, pseudo-octahedral crystals embedded in associated quartz +/- hematite +/- muscovite +/- cryptomelane matrix.

results.name: Akopovaite
results.description_short:
Unique combination of elements. Chemically but not structurally the CO3 analogue of dritsite (not a true analogy). One of the most alkaline lithium minerals.
A synthetic analogue is known.

results.name: Gladkovskyite
results.description_short: New structure type. Chemically related to auerbakhite.

results.name: Uroxite
results.description_short: First uranyl oxalate found in nature. Higher-hydrate counterpart of metauroxite.

results.name: Lussierite
results.description_short: New structure type. A characteristic feature is a bidentate linkage between an UO7 pentagonal bipyramid and a sulfate group.

results.name: Asimowite
results.description_short: The Fe2+ analogue of wadsleyite.

results.name: Amamoorite
results.description_short:
The Mn2+-Mn3+-dominant analogue of ilvaite.

The major difference is that manganilvaite has dominant manganese at only one of the three independent iron sites, whereas amamoorite has manganese replacing iron in all three sites.

results.name: Radekškodaite-(La)
results.description_short:
The La analogue of radekškodaite-(Ce). The Al-dominant analogue (or Al4-analogue) of zilbermintsite-(La).

New structure type.

results.name: Laverovite
results.description_short: Manganoan analogue of Zircophyllite.

results.name: Tschaunerite
results.description_short: A polymorph of ulvöspinel.

results.name: Feiite
results.description_short: Isostructural with synthetic Fe4O5.

results.name: Liuite
results.description_short: A high-pressure polymorph.

results.name: Ferri-mottanaite-(Ce)
results.description_short: The first Fe3+-dominant hellandite Group mineral.

results.name: Natrowalentaite
results.description_short:
Chemically and structurally related to walentaite.

May be treated as FeNaNaWP-analogue of halilsarpite.

results.name: Carmeltazite
results.description_short:
Has an atomic arrangement similar to that observed in a defective spinel structure.

Found in pockets of trapped melt interstitial to, or included in, corundum crystals.

Represents a relatively small group of minerals in which Zr and Ti are locate...

results.name: Avdeevite
results.description_short:
Unique combination of elements. First Na-dominant member of the group.

Differences when comparing to beryl:
- sum of large cations within the channels is >0.5 apfu
- Na dominates there

results.name: Nickeltyrrellite
results.description_short:
The Ni analogue of tyrrellite. Unique combination of elements.

Nickeltyrrellite formed in response to alteration of quijarroite + hansblockite + watkinsonite + clausthalite + penroseite aggregates by oxidizing, low-T, Cu-Ni-Co-Pb-bearing fluids at a...

results.name: Magnesiobermanite
results.description_short:
The Mg analogue of bermanite.
Magnesiobermanite is structurally related to ercitite, mengeite and coralloite.

Magnesiobermanite was recently (2018) found on a specimen collected from the White Rock No.2 quarry in the 1960s.

results.name: Nikmelnikovite
results.description_short: The only trigonal member of the garnet supergroup.

results.name: Llantenesite
results.description_short:
The Se analogue of spangolite. Unique combination of elements (at the upload time).

Compare alfredopetrovite and petermegawite.

results.name: Donwilhelmsite
results.description_short:
Structurally related to zagamiite. May be the Ca analogue of UM2004-47-SiO:AlCaNa.

The acicular habit and the very small size of these phases reflect rapid growth of the crystals during elevated shock pressures in less than tens of microseconds.

...

results.name: Glikinite
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue. The only currently known zinc oxysulfate mineral.

results.name: Šlikite
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements among the currently accepted minerals (compare 'UM1986-10-CO:ClHMgMnZn (also called Mineral F, Dunn, 1995)'). A rare case of a non-silicate oxysalt with separate Zn and Mg sites (compare reaphookhillit...

results.name: Orthocuproplatinum
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue. Compare 'Unnamed (Pt-Cu Alloy)'.

results.name: Nickolayite
results.description_short:
New structure type. One of four known Mo phosphide minerals (beside monipite - its nickel analogue), polekhovskyite, and tsikourasite), with chemical combination unique for natural oxygen-free compounds.

Structurally related to allabogdanite, floren...

results.name: Reaphookhillite
results.description_short: The Mg analogue of parahopeite. A rare case of a non-silicate oxysalt with separate Zn and Mg sites (compare falsterite, ferraioloite, and šlikite).

results.name: Davidbrownite-(NH4)
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements (compare rowleyite, though). Chemically somewhat similar to thebaite-(NH4), relianceite-(NH4) and dendoraite-(K): other oxalate-phosphate minerals. The first vanadium-bearing oxalate mineral (compare r...

results.name: Ognitite
results.description_short: Structurally related to melonite, chemically related to tellurohauchecornite. The BiTe analogue of melonite.

results.name: Stergiouite
results.description_short:
Structurally related to phosphophyllite and hopeite group. 
Chemically resembles prosperite, lotharmeyerite, gaitite, zincroselite and austinite.

results.name: Bouškaite
results.description_short:
New structure type. The first molybdenum sulfate mineral (but not unique chemical combination). Second molybdenyl-bearing mineral after vajdakite (the third species is hasanovite - another molybdenyl sulfate mineral).

Also compare the chemically sim...

results.name: Kenngottite
results.description_short:
Structurally related to (triclinic minerals) souzalite and gormanite.

Identical to phase UNK9 (Unknown no. 9) of Sejkora et al. (2006).

Associates also include a K-Mn oxide.

The structure is based on trimeric clusters made of face-shared octah...

results.name: Edscottite
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue. The third (more or less) purely iron carbide mineral after cohenite and haxonite.

results.name: Lazaraskeite
results.description_short: Known as a synthetic compound ('bis(glycolato)copper(II)') - first natural crystalline glycolate mineral. The other three are stanevansite (Mg), jimkrieghite (Ca), and lianbinite (NH4; more complex).

results.name: Spiridonovite
results.description_short: Discovered in a fragment from the cameronite holotype material.

results.name: Kollerite
results.description_short:
First confirmed ammonium sulfate(IV) (sulfite) mineral.

Associated with kollerite are AIS-1 is a trigonal (NH4)9Fe3+(SO3)6, AIS-2 is
a trigonal (NH4)2Fe2+(SO3)2. AIS-1 and AIS-2 are metastable phases that break down in a few weeks and a few years, ...

results.name: Nixonite
results.description_short: The Na analogue of jeppeite. Chemically related to freudenbergite and loparite-(Ce).

results.name: Khurayyimite
results.description_short:
New structure type.

Structure details:
* SiO4 and ZnO2(OH)2 tetrahedra forming (unusual) chains (loop-branched sechser single type, {lB, 11∞}[6Zn4Si4O21]) with Si–Si-Zn sequence; 
* neighbouring silicate tetrahedra of the corrugated chains are bri...

results.name: Siwaqaite
results.description_short:
The Cr (chromate) analogue of ettringite. First chromate-dominant group member. First chromate mineral to combine Ca and Al.

The temperature of formation is not higher than ~70–80 °C, based on mineral association and inferred from the formation cond...

results.name: Polekhovskyite
results.description_short:
The first described terrestrial Mo phosphide. A phosphorus-rich homolog meteoritic monipite.  Known synthetic analogue. 
Chemically related to monipite and tsikourasite.

Also compare nickolayite.

results.name: Mangani-pargasite
results.description_short: The Mn(III) analogue of pargasite, vanadio-pargasite and chromio-pargasite.

results.name: Natromarkeyite
results.description_short: Chemically and structurally related to markeyite (close to being its Na analogue).

results.name: Bohuslavite
results.description_short:
Chemically resembles destinezite, diadochite, and camaronesite. New structure type.

Note: type locality is Buca della Vena mine.

results.name: Tsikourasite
results.description_short:
Third Mo-Ni phosphide mineral after monipite and polekhovskyite.

Compare nickolayite.

Associates include "Ni-allabogdanite or Ni-barringerite and a V-sulphide".

A synthetic analogue is known.

results.name: Luxembourgite
results.description_short:
Isostructural with watkinsonite and litochlebite, but with Ag-Cu ordering in the crystal structure.

Crystal structure comprises:
- pseudotetragonal layer, 4-atoms thick (with Bi1, Bi2 ,Bi3, Pb, and Ag1 atoms), and
- pseudohexagonal layer, 1-atom t...

results.name: Andymcdonaldite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue.
Has an inverse trirutile structure.

results.name: Laurentthomasite
results.description_short: The Mg analogue of milarite.

results.name: Kahlenbergite
results.description_short: The K analogue of diaoyudaoite. The Al analogue of shagamite.

results.name: Scorticoite
results.description_short: Chemically resembles örebroite and UM2003-37-SiO:HMnSbZn.

results.name: Rumoiite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue.

Probably identical to UM2000-05-E:AuSn.

results.name: Shosanbetsuite
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue.

results.name: Giacovazzoite
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue (beta-Maus's Salt). Chemically especially related to scordariite - second currently known K-Fe oxysulfate mineral.

results.name: Pseudomeisserite-(NH4)
results.description_short: New structure type.

results.name: Smamite
results.description_short: New structure type.

results.name: Caseyite
results.description_short: New structure type. It is related to structures based on flat-Al13 polyoxometalate cation.

results.name: Langhofite
results.description_short: New structure type.

results.name: Magnanelliite
results.description_short: The Fe3+ analogue of alcaparrosaite.

results.name: Tennantite-(Zn)
results.description_short:
A new group member added due to the acceptance of the IMA 18-K proposal.

Less common than tennantite-(Fe) with which it forms a complete solid-solution series.

Compare, e.g., UM2001-13-S:AsCuSbZn.

results.name: Tetrahedrite-(Zn)
results.description_short:
Added due to the acceptance of the IMA 18-K proposal.
More common than tetrahedrite-(Fe).

results.name: Tennantite-(Fe)
results.description_short:
Added due to the acceptance of the IMA 18-K proposal.
More common than tennantite-(Zn) with which it forms a complete solid-solution series.

results.name: Tetrahedrite-(Fe)
results.description_short: Added due to the acceptance of the IMA 18-K proposal.

results.name: Kenoargentotetrahedrite-(Fe)
results.description_short:
Sb analogue of Kenoargentotennantite-(Fe).

The name kenoargentotetrahedrite-(Fe) partially supplants the former name freibergite for Fe>Zn members.

results.name: Lingbaoite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue.

Chemically related to empressite, hessite, stützite, and a number of approved unnamed species.

results.name: Gmalimite
results.description_short:
K (or K[]) analogue of zoharite. Also K[]Cu-analogue of owensite.

Chemically related to bartonite and rasvumite.

results.name: Ferroefremovite
results.description_short: Fe analogue of efremovite. Chemically related to sabieite and pyracmonite.

results.name: Limousinite
results.description_short:
A beryllophosphate mineral structurally related to phillipsite. Unique combination of elements. It is the third known natural zeolite-type beryllophosphate together with pahasapaite and wilancookite.

Chemically especially related to wilancookite and...

results.name: Nishanbaevite
results.description_short:
Unique combination of elements. New structure type. In terms of represeting a natural Al oxyarsenate it is similar to wrightite (chemically most close to nishanbaevite), alumoedtollite, dmisokolovite, and urusovite.

The arsenate and sulfate anions i...

results.name: Nazarovite
results.description_short:
Another natural Ni phosphide after nickelphosphide, halamishite, melliniite, negevite, transjordanite, and 'Unnamed (Ni-Fe Phosphide)'. 

Can be both of terrestrial and meteoritic origin.

Has the largest number of P atoms per formula unit among th...

results.name: Sangenaroite
results.description_short: "The Sb-rich end-member of ferdowsiite". May be treated as Sb-dominant (or close) analogue of the latter. Structure determined.

results.name: Taipingite-(CeCa)
results.description_short: Apparently the F analogue of cerite-(Ce).

results.name: Dritsite
results.description_short:
Unique combination of elements (the first approved natural lithium chloride). One of the most alkaline lithium minerals.
 2H polytype
Chemically but not structurally the Cl-analogue of akopovaite (not a true analogy).

results.name: Hiroseite
results.description_short:
The Fe analogue of bridgmanite (the latter is likely the most common species on Earth). 
First found and described by Bindi et al. (2020) from the Suizhou meteorite, a heavily shocked (S6) L6 chondrite that contains abundant high-pressure minerals.

results.name: Monchetundraite
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue. Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Maletoyvayamite
results.description_short: Unique combination of elements among the approved mineral species (however, compare 'Unnamed (Au-Telluride-Selenide)' and gachingite). Known synthetic analogue.

results.name: Bianchiniite
results.description_short: Unique combination of elements. New structure type. A natural Ti-V arsenite (diarsenite). Chemically related to hemloite and tomichite.

results.name: Halilsarpite
results.description_short: Chemically related to betpakdalite-CaMg. May be treated as MgCaMoAs-analogue of natrowalentaite.

results.name: Minakawaite
results.description_short:
Unique combination of elements (among the accepted and named mineral species). The Sb analogue of cherepanovite.

Probably identical to UM1979-19-Sb:Rh.

results.name: Magnesio-lucchesiite
results.description_short:
The Mg analogue of lucchesiite. Al6O-analogue of uvite and fluoruvite.

This species will likely displace the synthetic phase (anthropotype) oxy-uvite.

results.name: Metauroxite
results.description_short: The lower hydrate counterpart of uroxite. Second natural uranium (uranyl) oxalate. Known synthetic analogue. Structure determined.

results.name: Grokhovskyite
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue.

results.name: Fluorcarletonite
results.description_short:
The F-dominant analogue of carletonite.

The colour is caused by (CO3)•– hole defects.

results.name: Liudongshengite
results.description_short:
Unique combination of elements (first natural Zn-Cr carbonate). 
The Cr analogue of zaccagnaite.

The ZnCr analogue of fougèrite. Third Zn-Cr mineral after zincochromite and hemihedrite.

results.name: Roterbärite
results.description_short: A selenio-salt. Chemically the Se analogue of the (Pmmm-structured) malyshevite. Known synthetic analogue. Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Percleveite-(La)
results.description_short: The La-dominant analogue of percleveite-(Ce).

results.name: Radekškodaite-(Ce)
results.description_short: The Ce analogue of radekškodaite-(La).

results.name: Moabite
results.description_short:
Unique combination of (species-defining) elements (at the upload time; a similar combination is represented by yakubovichite reported in the same Newsletter). Also compare beershevaite. Chemically also somewhat comparable to lisanite.

New structure ...

results.name: Johnkoivulaite
results.description_short:
Unique combination of elements.


"This mineral is especially unique due to the strong pleochroism it shows from deep violet to nearly colorless when observed with polarized light".

When compared with beryl, it has most of Be substituted by B, Al...

results.name: Vittinkiite
results.description_short: Some Ca-poor "rhodonite" samples described previously are in fact vittinkiite, as pointed out by Shchipalkina et al. (2019).

results.name: Lauraniite
results.description_short: New structure type. Chemically resembles aldridgeite, edwardsite, and niedermayrite.

results.name: Yurgensonite
results.description_short:
The Sn-Ti-ordered analogue of katiarsite. Probably unique in terms of Sn-Ti separation into two independent sites.

Unique combination of elements. First natural tin arsenate to date.

The M(2)O6 octahedron has Sn4+ prevailing, while the M(1) site ...

results.name: Tetrahedrite-(Hg)
results.description_short:
The Sb analogue of tennantite-(Hg).
Chemically resembles gruzdevite.

Note: Some of the reliably analysed material previously described as Mercurian Tetrahedrite or Schwazite may in fact be tetrahedrite-(Hg).

results.name: Kodamaite
results.description_short: Similar to ellingsenite.

results.name: Northstarite
results.description_short: New structure type. First combination of tellurate and thiosulfate groups among minerals. Chemically somewhat resembles adanite, schieffelinite, and to some extent also eztlite.

results.name: Fulbrightite
results.description_short: The arsenate analogue of sincosite. First natural vanadyl arsenate.

results.name: Mauriziodiniite
results.description_short:
Chemically and structurally related to lucabindiite - its chlorine analogue. Unique combination of elements.

The iodine analogue of ermakovite.

results.name: Orishchinite
results.description_short: Ni-dominant analogue of allabogdanite.

results.name: Viteite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue. Unique combination of elements: first known mineral to combine palladium and indium.

It and its other PGE mineral associates are replaced by Pt-Pd-Fe-Cu alloys and Pt-Pd-Fe-Cu oxygenated compounds.

results.name: Windmountainite
results.description_short: "Associated minerals include albite, aegirine, fluorapophyllite-(K), natrolite, neotocite, and montmorillonite, the last of these being observed to replace primary windmountainite. It has a dull luster, silky in aggregates, is translucent and has an or...

results.name: Kreiterite
results.description_short: Fe3+ analogue of sokolovaite. Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Kingsgateite
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue. Unique combination of elements (among the approved minerals).

results.name: Fluorapophyllite-(NH₄)
results.description_short:
Ammonium dominant fluorapophyllite. The NH4 analogue of fluorapophyllite-(K). 

Unique combination of elements. 

First group member with essential ammonium.

results.name: Thalliomelane
results.description_short:
First Tl-dominant member of the group. Approximately a more Mn(IV)-rich TlCu analogue of cryptomelane and strontiomelane. First Tl- and Mn-dominant oxide mineral to date.

See also Thallian Cryptomelane.

Probably resulted from Tl-for-K replacement...

results.name: Esdanaite-(Ce)
results.description_short:
New structure type.

Chemically somewhat resembling steenstrupine-(Ce) (which, however, is a silicate-phosphate).

results.name: Melansonite
results.description_short:
Na-[]- fully siliceous and higher-hydrate-analogue of natromelansonite. Na-vacancy-Zr analogue of rhodesite. 

Chemically resembles georgechaoite. 

Belongs to the rhodesite mero-plesiotype series (Ferraris & Gula, 2005; Cadoni & Ferraris, 2009).

results.name: Saccoite
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Sergevanite
results.description_short:
Characterizes in coupled Ca+Mn and Na+Fe residence in the particular structural sites. This presumably lowers the typical R3m symmetry. The full (extended) formula is Na15(Ca3Mn3)(Na2Fe)Zr3Si2(Si3O9)2(Si9O27)2(OH)3·H2O.

A P3-structured variety (?) i...

results.name: Polyarsite
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Müllerite
results.description_short: The Fe3+ analogue of backite. Chemically somewhat similar to eztlite. The mineral occurs at various sub-localities of the Otto Mtn.

results.name: Drechslerite
results.description_short:
Related to lorándite (TlAsS2, monoclinic) and weissbergite (TlSbS2, triclinic). 

Sb and As are ordered in the crystal structure.

Also compare jankovićite, gillulyite, pierrotite; and gungerite.

results.name: Michalskiite
results.description_short: Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Evseevite
results.description_short:
The arsenate (or arsenic) analogue of moraskoite. Chemically somewhat related to polyarsite and nanlingite.

Evseevite is represented by two chemical varieties. The variety close to the end-member Na2Mg(AsO4)F gave the specimen considered as the holo...

results.name: Bennesherite
results.description_short:
Chemically especially related to andrémeyerite and also to gillespite. The first group member with dominant Ba and Fe2+. A parabasalt mineral.

Crystal structure details:
* layers comprising disilicate (Si2O7)6- groups and (Fe2+O4)6- tetrahedra
* t...

results.name: Alcantarillaite
results.description_short: Structurally related to walentaite. Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Jingsuiite
results.description_short:
The first boride mineral to date. Known synthetic analogue.

Also a minor, though common, phase in melt pockets within corundum of the Carmel Mt. basalts.

results.name: Bridgesite-(Ce)
Chiyokoite
results.description_short: Chemically somewhat similar to harkerite.

results.name: Badengzhuite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue. Second phosphide mineral with essential Ti after florenskyite.

Some[[1]] have suggested this is an anthropogenic material.

Most likely synonymous with 'UM1986-25-P:Ti'.

results.name: Zhiqinite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue. First purely titanium silicide mineral; second Ti-rich approved silicide mineral after zangboite.

Also chemically similar to kangjinlaite and, to some extent, wenjiite, UM1989-10-E:FeSiTi, and 'Unnamed (Fe-Si-Ti Alloy)'.

results.name: Bowlesite
results.description_short: Isotypic with cobaltite. Unique combination of (dominant) elements.

results.name: Gorerite
results.description_short:
An example of calcium ferrite aluminate. The AlFe (or, more specifically, AlFe11) analogue of hibonite. Also related to barioferrite by the CaAlFe11-for-BaFe12 substitution. 
Chemically close to brownmillerite-srebrodolskite series.

results.name: Alexkuznetsovite-(La)
results.description_short: The La analogue of alexkuznetsovite-(Ce). The La- and Mn-dominant analogue of biraite-(Ce). Unique combination of elements (also the only currently known mineral with La, Mn, and carbonate combined, at the upload time).

results.name: Fehrite
results.description_short: The Mg analogue of ktenasite (isotypic with it) and gobelinite. The only currently known purely Mg-Cu sulfate mineral.

results.name: Petrovite
results.description_short:
Chemically similar to saranchinaite and puninite. Interesting, i.a., in terms of NaCu separation / site occupancy. 

In the structure there are, i.a., isolated [Cu2(SO4)8]12- clusters.

results.name: Ellinaite
results.description_short:
The Cr analogue of harmunite and marokite. The Ca analogue of chenmingite and xieite. Chemically similar to chromatite.

A high-temperature (>1000 oC), but variable-pressure mineral.

A post-spinel structure.

results.name: Adanite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue.


Not to be confused with adamite. Chemically resembles northstarite (which, however, is a tellurate-thiosulfate), schieffelinite, and to some extent also eztlite.

results.name: Grammatikopoulosite
results.description_short:
Structurally related to florenskyite. Unique combination of elements.

Grammatikopoulosite was discovered in a heavy mineral concentrate.

results.name: Dutrowite
results.description_short:
The first tourmaline group member with essential titanium. The Fe2+-analogue of magnesio-dutrowite. Unique combination of elements.

A Mg-dominant analogue, probably magnesio-dutrowite, is reported from Zlatá Idka, Slovakia (Bačík et al., 2022).

M...

results.name: Arrheniusite-(Ce)
results.description_short: The Mg-As analogue of hundholmenite-(Y) (however, the chemical relation of the two species seems to be more complex). Unique combination of elements. Similar to vicanite-(Ce) and laptevite-(Ce) in partial occupation of B at the T5 site.

results.name: Liraite
results.description_short: Chemically quite similar to maneckiite.

results.name: Seaborgite
results.description_short:
New structure type. Unique combination of elements. Also, the only currently approved Li-U mineral species (compare 'ferganite'), and the only lithium-bearing hydrogensulfate mineral.

One of few uranyl hydrogensulfate minerals, the others being bela...

results.name: Michitoshiite-(Cu)
results.description_short: CsCl-type structure. Unique combination of elements assuming Ge is the mandatory constituent.

results.name: Hagstromite
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements. Fourth recognized Te-C-O species after mroseite, thorneite, and agaite (somewhat chemically similar to the latter two).

results.name: Waipouaite
results.description_short: New structure type.

results.name: Eliopoulosite
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue. Chemically similar to patrónite.

results.name: Kesebolite-(Ce)
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements.

results.name: Ramosite
results.description_short:
The Mn analogue of franckeite. Unique combination of elements.

Cell parameters for H-slab: a = 6.23, b = 3.69, c = 17.59  Å, β = 93.3°.

results.name: Pošepnýite
results.description_short:
Structure determined.

results.description_short: Unique combination of (species-defining) elements.

results.description_short: Unique combination of elements. The NH4 analogue of tinsleyite. The Al analogue of spheniscidite. Described from a guano deposit.

Structurally related to schubnelite: both bear edge-sharing dimers of Fe3+O6 octahedra, linked by distorted VO4 tetrahedra.

results.description_short: The most reliable method to distinguish the polymorphs is the X-ray study. In polished thin sections, the 2O and 1M modifications can be distinguished using electron backscatter diffraction (EBSD).

results.description_short: The Sr3CeZn-analogue of vladykinite.

results.name: Karlleuite
results.description_short: Known synthetic analogue. Chemically (compositionally) related to marokite, wernerkrauseite, and 'Unnamed (Ca-Mn Oxide)'.

results.name: Yamhamelachite
results.description_short:
Known synthetic analogue. Unique combination of elements (at the upload time).

The first approved Cr diphosphate mineral.

Other diphosphate minerals (also known from the type-locality area) include anastasenkoite, lisanite, nabateaite, and shasui...

results.name: Pabellóndepicaite
results.description_short: Related to bojarite, chanabayaite, and triazolite, all containing the 1,2,4-triazole ring. Seems to be the first triazolate-nitrate and the second ammine-nitrate mineral (after shilovite) (to be confirmed).

results.name: Pfaffenbergite
results.description_short: The Ca(Al4Si12)-analogue of wodegongjieite; the KNa3-analogue of kokchetavite.

results.name: Vladkuzminite
results.description_short: New structure type. Unique combination of elements (at the upload time).

results.name: Rinmanite-(Zn)
results.description_short: The Zn analogue of rinmanite.

results.name: Bacaferrite
results.description_short: New structure type

results.name: Midbarite
results.description_short:
structure determined

 near Ye'elim Mount, Negev desert, Israel (31°14′21.9" N, 35°16′54.8" E)

results.name: Fluor-rossmanite
results.description_short: Structure determined. The F analogue of rossmanite.

results.name: Shiranuiite
results.description_short: The Rh4+-analogue of ezochiite; the Rh, or rather RhRh-analogue of malanite.

results.name: Allanite-(Sm)
results.description_short: Unique combination of elements (at the upload time); the third approved mineral species with samarium as the species-defining element (compare florencite-(Sm) and monazite-(Sm)).

results.name: Fanguangite
results.description_short: New structure type. The first molybdenyl (and molybdenum) hydroxophosphate; also the simplest molybdenum phosphate among minerals (status: April 2024).

results.name: Nigelcookite
results.description_short:
Not chemically unique: compare ferribushmakinite (that is, however, a vanadate-phosphate).

The V analogue of plumbojohntomaite; the FeV-analogue of plumboperloffite.

results.name: Fluor-rewitzerite
results.description_short: The fluorine analogue of rewitzerite

results.name: Siligiite
results.description_short: New structure type. Chemically comparable with haywoodite, cherokeeite, sulfatoredmondite, and zincochenite.

results.name: Plumbojohntomaite
results.description_short: The Fe3+-analogue of nigelcookite.

results.name: Sperlingite
results.description_short: The Fe3+Al(OH)-analogue of macraeite. Related to rewitzerite.
